text: Terrible oysters! They were small, tasteless and over-priced. There were even shards of shell in the oyster meat. I had to spit them out. Avoid this place!,

First some minor complaints: Glasses that hold 10 sips of water, indistinguishable salt/pepper shakers because they're opaque, chairs too tall for the tables making you hunch over, and mixing up one of our party's orders. 

Now some major complaints: inconsistency and lack of concern. My angel hair pasta with scallops was bland and watery. The scallops were poorly seared and I could easily tell that they weren't even seasoned. I went over to try my sister's plate since she had the same order; it was definitely better. Why the inconsistency? I notified the waitress about my dish expecting an apology at the very least. She gave an apathetic, "oh really?" instead. 

Thanks for the good service?

I read the reviews before going here so I was ready for a hit or miss.  MISS!  The clam chowder does indeed suck.  All you taste is ham.  The bread bowl it comes in is dry and old.  The steamed mussels and clams is terrible.  It also came with a dry, stale piece of bread.  The fried clams were even worse.  The clams were all lumped up and stuck together and the batter was gross.  White Castle even does a better fried clams. 

I had the linguini with clams with a few pieces of small, whole clams and a watery, soup like sauce.  Your average NY pizza joint does it better.  

The only thing that I enjoyed was my margarita.  

If you enjoy lower quality seafood restaurants such as Red Lobster, etc. then you'll probably enjoy this place, too.

I was there during Thanksgiving weekend. Pretty good selection of seafood plates. The food is really good and decent priced. I had the shrimp platter which was tasty and we shared a calamari plate. The strawberry mojitos were great as well.  Overall, i would definitely recommend.

AWESOME CRAB LEGS!! we came on a thursday night, got in quickly, and had the best crab legs ive ever had! and bomb lobster mac n cheese!! they give you a great quantity of crab legs a full meal. and our server Genaro was fantastic!  we had a lovely little date night experience, and dont forget the mango mojito!! just go here!

What an epic fail... where to even begin? We were drawn to try this place because of their grand opening promotion of BOGO entrees valid on Mon. Tue, Wed thru 10/10/12. After being seated, it took over 15 minutes for our server to come by and even offer us glasses of water. We showed her the promotional coupon and asked if we could order 4 entrees between the 3 of us, and she answered yes, we would get the 2 least expensive entrees free. We decided to go with a bread bowl of clam chowder ($9), 2 orders of the fish & chips ($18 each), crab louie entree salad ($17), and linguine with clam sauce ($17), and later on key lime and apple pies for dessert ($7 each).

For some reason they thought it would be acceptable to combine both orders of the fish & chips onto one plate, but we got jipped because there was only 1 small order's worth of fries. We decided not to make a fuss over it. There were 6 pieces of beer battered fish altogether. Unfortunately the batter was very thick and greasy yet also soggy on the bottom. After my first piece, I couldn't take it anymore and ended up peeling off almost all of the batter from subsequent pieces. The mediocre tartar sauce was too runny and lacked enough acidity to balance out the mayonnaise.

As for the salad, the crab meat contained several small shell fragments and was flavorless. Our friend thought his clam chowder was so-so, and it didn't appear creamy enough. Also, the bacon overpowered the clam flavor. The linguine was ok, but nothing memorable.

Desserts were meh. Our key lime pie was dominated by whipped cream. The key lime part was more like mousse, and the flavor was far too subtle. The pie crust was quite thick and somewhat soggy. Our friend didn't even finish his apple pie, and it wasn't because he was full. 

As for service, this is where it gets interesting. As soon as we received our entrees, our server asked us how the food was, when it was obvious that we hadn't even touched our food yet. We answer that we just got our food, and she replied that she would be back to check on us, which she never did until we were almost done eating our entrees. My water glass remained empty for over 10 minutes before it was refilled. At another point, she came by and put her water pitcher down on the table and asked if we were interested in dessert. We said sure. She ignored my more than half empty water glass and picked her water pitcher back up and left to get the dessert menus. When she returned with the menus about 10-15 minutes later and eventually returned to take our order after another 10-15 minutes, my water glass still was not refilled. In fact, my glass was never refilled after that first time and remained near empty. Finally, we flag her down and ask for the check. Eventually, she brings the check, but says she can't apply the promotional BOGO discount until we give her the coupon. We tell her we already gave you the coupon when we placed our order. She mumbles something while leaving me the bill and takes off. At this point, I'm not sure what is going on. Was she expecting me to give her my credit card before seeing the corrected bill? Several minutes later, she comes back and grabs the check from me with no explanation. She reprocesses the bill, but it only shows one discounted entree instead of two. When I point this out, she says that we only got 3 entrees: 2 fish & chips and a linguine with clam sauce. We tell her we also got the crab louie entree-sized salad. She mumbles something about double checking the menu. Eventually she comes back and says that the manager told her to apply the second discount. However, when she hands me the check, it is somebody else's check with their credit card! I hadn't even given her my credit card yet. She didn't realize her mistake until I pointed that out. While we await her return for the umpteenth time, we ponder whether she is on drugs or just really really stupid. After another 10 minutes or so, I am able to take care of the check and finally get out of there. Starting to notice a pattern? The time between when our server would check on us was long and it added up. We were there almost 2 hours because of the interminably slow service.

To summarize, their food is sub-par and pricey for what you get, and the abysmal service is some of the worst I've experienced in a long while. Stay away, or don't say I didn't warn you!

The customer service is horrible. The prices are to expensive for the quality of food being served. The only tasty delicious item was the stuffed mushrooms. And the strawberry shortcake is yummy. Don't try or consider ordering the lobster sandwich ....very dry no ...food was cold and they only served like less than a ounce of lobster for $27 I might as well ordered a entire lobster for that price. I recommend this place only if you really have no other options to eat at.

Went here on a whim after glancing at the menu. It was later in the night (around 9 pm) so there weren't too many people in the restaurant, which made our service very good. The food was outstanding! I had the herb and parmesan crusted tilapia and it was cooked perfectly. My boyfriend had the crab legs and it looked like there was about 2 pounds of crab. Our portions were huge for the price (maybe they gave us more since it was the end of the night) which was nice. Fun decor inside. Curious to try during normal dinner hours but I will definitely be returning to this restaurant next time I am in Vegas.
Overall rating...Mehhhhhhh. Got the cajun seafood pasta. Bland. Just bland. No amount of salt, pepper, or malt vinegar could elevate the taste. Three Words: Old Bay Seasoning. Try it. You'll like it.

I would compare the quality of the food with Red Lobster.  I did feel it was overpriced for what you got.  

I had the clam chowder, which was good (nothing special.)  I also had the shrimp platter, which was good.  The shrimps were very large and not overly breaded.  I was not a fan of the French fries as they tasted odd to me.  I was the only one that thought this so it could have been my taste.  I also did not like the coleslaw but I like mine vinegary and this coleslaw was not.

OK seafood for the price, esp compared to some other Vegas restaurants. WE ordered one of the daily specials (blackened grouper with etouffe) & grilled salmon. Service seemed slow, as people near us sat down AFTER we ordered, but got served before us (they both had fried seafood dishes as we could see their table). My companion said the salmon was OK, but was not impressed or what she would call memorable. When I tried some, it seemed overcooked to me. My blackened grouper was OK as well. No very peppery and seemed quite salty.

My Wife had a huge seafood platter that she said was very good. I don't eat seafood because of allergies, and they were fine with my request to prepare my food separately. Service was very good as well.
Food was amazing! Got the mermaid mojito, stuffed mushrooms and fisherman's platter. And our server was very nice.

We visited the Seafood Shack twice during our stay at TI.(3/31- 4/4)  We had always gone for the Happy Hours and had tried a couple appetizers but never had a full dinner. 
Let me start with the staff- we always sat at the bar and got to know most of the guys. Frank was probably who we spent the most time with- he was great- good bartender and could put a smile on people's faces! But everyone was nice and friendly and knew their cocktails. 
We had a 2 for 1 coupon so we wanted dinner- I had the Rainbow Trout - blackened with rice pilaf and veggies (Brussel sprouts and broccoli). The trout was cooked perfectly- flaky and tender and moist- it was yummy! My husband had the Cajun Seafood Pasta and was thrilled with it. The shrimp were huge in it! Nice spicy kick- but not overwhelming.  Our second meal- I ordered Blackened Striped Sea Bass with Etouffee which was a very nice mix of seafood and a great spicy brown sauce. My husband had the Lobster Burrito and was very happy with that- I don't think he shared a bite! 
We sat at the bar watching several people next to us eat a lot of different things- the Lobster Mac n Cheese was a big hit, the Ahi Tuna Poke, the Lobster Cobb and the crab- the Snow and the King- I heard no one complain or even say eh- so-so. Everyone said their food was very good!  
You may be able to find a 2 for 1 so it makes it a great value as well! They have Happy Hour Specials 4-6PM and 10PM- close- so it is nice to not pay huge prices for cocktails. It is a must stop.
Nice! Really liked the food here. The spinach/lobster soup was my favorite. The steak was great. Price was decent for all the food you get. $42.

My husband & I both ordered the Parmesan Cod over Lobster Mashed Potatoes & corn bisque...absolutely wonderful!!!  And even though we were there right at closing time, the service was flawless and made us feel totally welcome and I rushed.  A great experience overall.

We stayed at Treasure Island so we got a buy one get one free dinner coupon. Walked in around 9:30pm after walking around most of the day. They seated us immediately and were very attentive even though it was past the dinner rush. The salmon was AMAZING. I have a very strict diet because of food allergies and found their menu to offer several choices for me. When I go back to Vegas, I will be sure to eat here again.
Food was tasty,  but the food comes out REALLY slow. I had a groupon, but the prices are a little steep for fried food.

Loved it. Ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl (a little heavy on the bacon, but appealed to hubby's taste), steamed clams- wonderful large juicy clams with no sand, and the pan roast with New England sauce.  I can't say enough about the pan roast, so awesomely delish. A tad salty but went well with the pilaf, the best I've ever had. Palace Station pan roast is the bomb but this is even better IMO. We tried to return for dinner but it was after 10 pm and were closed.  It is on our encore list for our next visit to LV. 4.5 stars rounded up.

I ordered the crusted tilapia, which came with green beans, rice pilaf, and a grilled lemon. It was yummy and the price was decent. The crust on the tilapia was a bit thick, but other than that it was very good. I also got the red sangria which was delicious.

I really enjoyed the food at the Seafood Shack! I had the lobster stuffed mushrooms and Cajun Crawfish and my husband had a bowl of clam chowder that was delicious and Ahi Tuna that he really enjoyed! The server was very attentive! We were very pleaded overall!

I got a groupon for this place and went there during my vegas stay. 

I wasn't sure if it was because of my groupon or because it was actually true, but when I ordered the seafood shack clam bake (that was supposed to include a whole maine lobster, clams, mussels, prawns, and sausage), the waiter informed us that they were out of lobsters and mussels - what seafood restaurant would be out of not one, but two types of seafood? He informed that they could substitute lobster for crab legs and the mussels for additional clams. We weren't picky so we said that was fine. When the clam bake came, the flavours were pretty good, but the seafood didn't taste very fresh, and the clams were overcooked and shriveled up. 

From all the restaurants on the strip that we could visit next time we come, I don't think I'll back to this one.

I was in Las Vegas for three nights. I dined at some supposedly great resteraunts. I have had my order messed up, raw chicken, and poor service. This is the first establishment I went to without researching reviews. This was the best. My server, Sergio, was great. The knowledge of gluten free options and a separate menu was above average. The shrimp tacos and cocktails were great. This is my first review because they deserve a positive one.
I wish I knew the bus boy's name as he was exceptional as well.

I was pleasantly surprised with this one. I really wasn't expecting this to be that great, but since we were staying at TI, it made sense to try it out.

Appetizer-wise, we started with the lobster stuffed mushrooms and the fried clams. The mushrooms came out on a sizzling baking dish with bubbling mornay sauce. The filling actually had some texture to it from the shrimp that was also in there along with the lobster, unlike a lot of generic mushroom filling. The rich mornay sauce was a really nice contrast to the clean mushroom flavor. And you can't argue with fried clams. Especially when they were fresh - no sogginess inside from canned clams here!

We split the clam bake for two, banking on the fact that it wouldn't be that big since the appetizers were plenty large. We were wrong. There were two lobster tails along with clams, mussels, shrimp and several whole sausages. Plus potatoes and corn AND a side of coleslaw. This also came with a side of the same mornay sauce that the stuffed mushrooms had been in. Everything was delicious and unlike plenty of so-called seafood restaurants that cook the heck out of everything, nothing was overdone. 

At this point we gave up on even attempting dessert, but we will have to try that when we inevitably go back!

Received a 2 for 1 coupon upon hotel check-in and decided to give this place a try. Visited on 12/26 night and wasn't too busy.

Seven Sea - portion is huge and it also came with a side of rice. Everything is good except the white fish... I like fish in general, but somehow the fish they used is kinda fishy and overcooked... I finished everything except the fish.

16oz Steak - to my surprise the lobster cream spinach is really, really good! I first thought it is spinach cooked with lobster sauce, but there are actual lobster meat in it, like a lot of them too! (My bf is allergic to seafood so I swap my rice with his spinach :D)

-1 star: Service - seems a bit slow, plus the waiter never checked on us until the end of the meal but he did check up other tables (across of us) several times, I guess because we only ordered 1 beer and we don't look rich compare to the other table? LOL~

I like the decor and the atmosphere, you can also see the actions in the kitchen. Will come back again if we get another 2-1 coupon (it does make a huge difference on the bill), otherwise there are just too many eateries in Vegas waiting for me to explore. :)
Over priced FOOD! Ordered the lobster and crab stuffed mushrooms for 13.95 ... And not worth it you only get four and they tasteless and microwaved so definitely not fresh!

I would avoid this restaurant. At a minimum I was expecting good food considering the cost. We ordered crab stuffed mushrooms for an appetizer. They were basically slimy mushrooms with little to no crab. I had the clam chowder bread bowl as an entree. There was literally no flavor whatsoever and had more onions than cream/broth. The bread for the bread bowl was so salty I couldn't even eat that. I can honestly say I've had better food at a hospital cafeteria. We spent $100 for two people and I will never be back. Huge disappointment!!

My husband and I ate here last night. We each had rainbow trout. It was delicious, as were the veggies and rice pilaf that accompanied it. We would definitely eat here again if ever at TI. No complaints at all!

Treasure Island - Seafood Shack.

Had dinner ala Groupon. Very clean, pleasant staff, quick service, great quality and quantity of well prepared food.

We started with a half dozen very cold, thick, and flavorful Oysters on the Half shell. They came with a champagne slush that was mixed with a spicy sauce. Topping the oysters with this was fantastic!! Each oyster with the slush was cold, mildly spicy, and extremely flavorful. I should have ordered a dozen oysters and a quart of that champagne slush. We also had a white wine steamed mix of mussels and clams. This offering came hot and plentiful. Plump mussels and clams in a great broth. The garlic points that were with the bowl were not enough to dunk up all the broth. I will ask for more toast next time.

My Wife and I are confirmed "Food Sinners". I could care less how terrible fried food is for me. It is worth your life here in the desert to get a decent Jersey Shore fried Seafood Dinner. Well, we found a place that knows how to do it. This TI Seafood Shack does a fried seafood platter that would get the blessing of Captain Nemo himself. The plate contained big portions of thick white fish that was fried to perfection along with shrimp and scallops, all big and all very fresh. Hey, we are NOT talking   pre-frozen stuff here, we are talking boat to belly fresh. Cole slaw, fresh French fries, tartar sauce and cocktail sauce rounded the whole thing out. When we were done eating, there was no film of grease on the plate. Each piece of fried seafood had only the fresh fried taste of that variety of ocean denizen it was. There was no grease on our hands and no greasy smell either. The white wine by the glass and my very cold beer added to the pleasure of this meal.

Libby had a piece of key lime pie for dessert. The pie was chiffon type, not that jello like stuff you tend to get in this area. It was tall, limey zippy, and sweet. I had to fight her for a couple tastes by the fork full. (Wives are not allowed to refuse Husbands tastes).

I did have a coffee and EL Wife-O had hot tea. By the time we left I felt a lot like a bowling ball. 

The service, food and casual atmosphere in the Seafood Shack are just what most of us want when we need to get to the show or on to the gaming tables. This is great food at a reasonable price. Remember you pay for fresh and you pay for quality. I don't have a problem with that, ever!!

Generally, I try to stay away from restaurants with the word "shack" in their name.  But, as I will eat practically anything born and raised in the sea, I decided to check this place out.

I found the menu to be suprisingly lengthy.  There is everything from Long John Silver's type fried fare to Cioppino and salad Nicoise.

I chose the Cioppino ($25) which was pretty tasty.  The broth was flavorful but, unfortunately, the accompanying seafood was a bit overcooked.  They also skimped  on the clams and mussels.  But, in a jam, I would order this again.  Honestly, I found this Cioppino as good as RM Seafood's. 

I also tried the lobster mac and cheese side that came with the Cioppino for $6.95 more.  Total disappointment.  Bland, bland, bland and tiny, tiny pieces of lobster.  Not worth the price or the calories.

I found it a bit odd that they didn't provide bread with the meal considering the entrees are a bit pricey.  If you're gonna charge fancy prices, step up the game!

Service was good, atmosphere was blah (lobster claw salt and pepper shakers were cute, though).  I'll probably go back but there are better seafood restaurants on the strip.

P.S. - Carlos Mencia ate at the table next to me. Weird.
one of the best seafood restaurants I have ever eaten. the food is great, the service is fabulous and the price not bad plus if you stay at Treasure island take advantage of the coupons. I give 5+
Right on the strip at TI. Food was mediocre - I had seafood medley but salads were not very fresh. The place was reasonably priced however given it's location on the strip.

I thought the food and appetizers were great and tasty got the lobster roll totally awesome full of lobster meat couldn't finish it. Ate it for lunch the next day the flavor were even better. I will be going back for more.

Debating where to go for dinner as we headed back to our hotel, we were handed a 2 for 1 coupon to Seafood Shack and our plans were decided for us. Set up to look like a harbour (fishing nets and the like decorated the place, even cute lobster claw shaped S&P shakers!), we looked over the menu once we were seated. Majority of the items are deep fried and battered (as most food is in Vegas!), I settled on the grilled tilapia that came with steamed veggies & rice palif. I was pleasantly surprised that my food was nicely flavoured and light, since I thought I was risking it by going somewhat healthy. 

I think restaurants that aren't right on the strip get overlooked, so the coupons are a good marketing tactic. It got us through the door and we got a decent meal out of it at a discounted price.

The food is awesome! I had the seven seas, it's really good! All ingredients was fresh. The shrimps and scallops are so big. Omg. It was worth the money. 
The lobster mac and cheese is really yummy too, absolutely loved it. 
The salmon with stuffed lobster is good too. 
Nice setting at the bar, however, only one girl was working and it was kinda slow.

Crazy fast service, knowledgeable wait staff., delicious food, reasonable prices!  Had the Cajun pasta which had a very decent amount of shrimp, crab, etc with a perfect linguini in a Cajun sauce. Spicy but not over the top. Added a clam and mussel steamer....lots of good eating for around $30.

Nicely done interior, very casual. About a twenty minute wait for seating on Wednesday might at 6pm. Nice lounge area and bar to wait at. 

On menu many more grilled and steamed selections as well as a few typical fried items.
Genero was our waiter and was very fast and prompt. Get advice on what to eat and very friendly. Food was awesome and filling. Great looking sea restaurant.

Not impressive. The food was bland, over priced and the portions were small. The mojitos and margaritas were $8, which isn't bad. The waitress had a preference of customers. I posted a photo of my receipt.

Great place on the strip to have dinner. I usually don't eat on the strip because it's overly priced and seasoned trying to make you believe it's something new or better. I have gotten better food off the strip at a quarter of the price. This place is great, will go back and recommend it.

I gave it 2 stars for this reason. We chose Seafood shack for my birthday dinner prior to seeing Mystere. When I ask the waiter if they offer a birthday shot or beer he quickly shot me down( no pun) and said, maybe a piece of cake. Not a good start. Like you can't give a customer a $5 birthday comp for choosing YOUR restaurant on a special day?!! This baffles me.. Out of 1000's of restaurants we chose yours and you can't even acknowledge my birthday for a measly comp beer or shot?  the meal itself was very good but the whole  dismissing my birthday request ruined it. Sorry, but the little things count.  Can you imagine my review if the waiter would have said, "absolutely, what is your choice, up to x amount of dollars". I promise you he would have been given a bigger tip and the review would have been amazing. I don't  think I was asking for much. Alert to seafood shack, give your customers SOMETHING besides cake for choosing YOUR RESTAURANT on their birthday.  Hell, check their id's to verify It makes for a much more special experience.

The food here was really good and the price was pretty reasonable for the strip. I had the Coconut Shrimp platter. It was prepared excellently. They had a pineapple sauce on the side that was really sweet. My wife had the Chicken Linguini and it was pretty good also. I'd come back.

Was excited to eat here until I actually got here. Sat at the bar and ordered the water & Cajun seafood pasta. The bartender then tried to make me pay for my food right after I ordered it because he was "leaving"..... i rejected that and had my card held to open a tab. He was rude and didn't even bring me my water until I pointed out to him everything he had done wrong. He leaves and another bartender starts servicing us. 9 minutes later they bring me some pasta with spinach and mushrooms.... i asked the bartender "what is this?" Before he could finish his word he looked at it and shook his head and caught an attitude with me when I got frustrated and said "nevermind I'd rather not eat here". And then threw my plate back down and walked away..... i will never go back to this establishment and for that kind of restaurant they should have way better service. Idk if it's because I was black or what but I'm definitely spreading the word.....

Although the service was great and the ambience was nice, I wasn't very satisfied with my meal. My BF got the Filet Mignon with Lobster Stuffed crab. I got the King Crab dish which came with grilled veggies & Rice pilaf. The food portions for both entrees were good! We thought his filet mignon and shrimp were good/average. The meat was tender and the stuffed shrimp was tasty. The crab legs however were disappointing.I thought the quality was average at best. Based on the texture & smell of the crab meat, I do not believe it was fresh. My BF and I received a hotel coupon for "2 entrees for the price of 1" which was a great deal!  I do not think either of the entree dishes were worth their price.

Great dinner again. We had dinner before our show. My husband had the king crab and it was a nice portion. I had the filet with stuffed shrimp. The filet was nicely seasoned and cooked perfectly. I wasn't a fan of the stuffing, but it was not bad. Both meals came with vegetables, so we would have told them to not to bring out the rice and fries that came with the meals. Our service was very good also.
Just came back from thanksgiving dinner.  Excellent food, service, and atmosphere!   This is my go to place for any occasion.   It was amazing!
Disappointing to say the least... Good service but the food was terrible!  We would not return here there are many better places nearby,,,,,,,,

Great food! Fast service! We had the best time! Matt,the manager, was very helpful. He recommended their signature drinks, which were perfect. Overall an amazing experience. Definitely will be coming here often!

Great food and fast service. The kids and I had tickets to see Mystere at 7:00pm on Sunday night.  I wanted to eat at Treasure Island so I didn't have to worry about Strip traffic and being late.  The other restaurants were very dim and the kids didn't gravitate towards them.  The Seafood Shack was bright and had very simple nautical decor.  Dinner starts at 5:00Pm.  They are extremely kids friendly.  $6.95 kids meal that comes with drinks is a great value for Vegas.  The kids love getting "wikki stix" instead of crayons.  
Both my kids had the fried shrimp. My daughter got rice on the side while my son got mac and cheese.  The food was delicious however my kids had a hard time eating the shrimp.  The shrimp tasted too adult for them, it was herb and garlic crusted.   All in all it was great.  My only thing would be for them to consider making a different batter for the kids.

Tonight was a delicious start to our spring vacation! The service was wonderful, very nice and friendly. My girls ordered coconut shrimp and fried cod, and they left nothing on the plate. My husband ordered the Cajun Seafood pasta and I ordered The blackened striped sea bass ettoufe. Now, we go to New Orleans often and have this kind of dishes and this was as good as it gets! I recommend it to any great seafood lover.

My husband and I chose to eat here on our recent visit to Vegas.  Having show tickets inside TI we thought that the menu choices looked good and it was convenient.  First let me begin with the fact that our server " Sergio " was very curt and not very friendly or welcoming. He was almost robotic.  He spoke very fast and we had to ask him to repeat much of what he said. I must give Kudos to a blonde Spanish woman who refilled our drinks  who was genuine and anxious to please.  I ordered the Parmesan tilapia which tasted like it was coated in shake and bake.  Tasted just awful.  I scrapped the coating off the fish and forced myself to eat due to the $19.95 price   My husband ordered the special of the night which was sea bass and pasta with other seafood.   For the $35 price the portion size was inadequate and the dish lackluster.  Save your $$$ and eat elsewhere for better quality food and better service.

My friends and I decided to try Seafood Shack inside Treasure Island, despite the mix reviews on Yelp. It was Friday evening at 7ish and the place was not busy at all and we were seated instantly. The decor and chalkboard signs I thought were pretty cool.

I've decided not to order an appetizer so I may have some room for a desert. I was craving for some seafood, spice and heat. So when I saw the Cajun Seafood Pasta for $24.95, it was a match made in heaven! Today was my cheat day and I could not wait for my meal to come!

When my meal came, presentation was well executed! Unfortunately, that's all the positive thing I can share with my meal. By far, this is my least favorite cajun pasta I have ever tasted!

Improvements needed:
* Great tasting cajun seasoning and good balance of heat explode in your HAPPY mouth! Not with this cajun seafood pasta! You be the judge :)
* This pasta to me was bland that desperately needed more cajun seasoning.
* I was very disappointed that the veggies were barely cooked celery, red peppers, and onions. The seafood and the creamy sauce were average.
* The toasted bread with grilled marks was a total failure! The bread was days old! The taste and texture were totally "toasted"!
* The chocolate cake was just average. The cake was not that moist. The fudge icing on the other hand, was rich and not too sweet. 

Overall, the staff was attentive and friendly. No doubt this place has a lot of potential, but needs a lot of improvement. However, I am not rushing to go back. There are too many choices in Vegas that serves great quality of food. Check out their menu:

http://www.treasureisland.com/images/restaurants/seafood_shack/menu.pdf

Fourth  time here:
Third time ordering the same thing. 
Lobster tacos. 
Wife loves lobster hors d'oeuvres , lobster stuffed salmon. Lobster here in general is excellent. 
(I don't really care for lobster straight, I like it as a major flavoring in a medley of flavors)
Fast , eceeeeeeedinly friendly service !


Did I say exceedingly friendly service. 
That's at least 66% why I return to this hotel. They have long time , loyal , 
Awesome, personable representatives .

"Syd"
Bartender/waiter. 
My accolades to him. 
The smile is infectious 
The service is , home-friendly 
The energy ....,fun to be around , even while  de energizing. 

Way to
Go SYD 

I'll be back

It was late, I was tired and wasn't expecting much.  The Alaskan White on tap and a wonky looking bowl of clam chowder picked me right up.  I've never seen anyone turn a bread bowl on it's side and then fill it lengthwise before, not pretty, but still tasty.  

We didn't order a real meal, just some appetizers the crab cakes were small but nice and full of lump crab meat.  And best of all it was a good value, cheaper and better quality food than Sr Frogs.

Great food and drinks! I had the Lobster stuffed Salmon and it was soooooo good. I recommend adding the lobster mac and cheese because it was to die for! Perfect service. Our server Kelly was awesome and the manager Matt was just as great! This is a hidden gem in Treasure Island.

Who would expect a restaurant at non-fancy side of the spectrum in a mega resort could be good?

Well, this place was quite a surprise in that regard. Foods here are tasty!

Low quality seafood prepared by cafeteria chefs.  Fresh fish and shellfish have odor and texture that suggest they should have been served a few days ago.  Fried items are soggy and soaked in grease.  At half the price the low quality might be forgiven, but I will never go back to this place.

Even with the Groupon I regretted the visit.  Most of the oyster bars at even the modest resorts serve much better food - for example, Sunset Station and South Point.

We had a Groupon for this place and were sorry we bought it. I ordered the "Lobster Roll" . I've HAD lobster rolls in Maine and this wasn't one. It was a "Lobster SALAD roll" . the whole inside bottom of the bun was layered with lettuce so as to BOOST the look of the thing. Not terrible BUT NOT a lobster roll. My wife ordered the fish and chips and it was crispy on the outside but doughy and gooey on the inside.More batter than fish. She said the fish stunk and didn't finish it...and got sick that night. I would avoid this place like the plague.

This restaurant exudes horrible customer. I ordered the oldster tacos with a side salad which consisted of corn. I received my entree with a notice black strand of hair and asked if my meal can be returned. The waitress argued that it was a piece of corn silk. This went on for about a minute until she agreed to take it back to the kitchen. I felt as though my safety was disregarded which made me very uncomfortable. The manager arrived. I alerted him that there was a hair in my salad. which the waitress said was corn silk which "turned black. " He agreed with the waitress stating sometimes that does happen. He did offer to get me something else. However, I was unable to stomach anything else this restaurant had to offer due to this service. Hopefully, this was just a bad day and this has not happened to any other customers.
We didn't order anything to eat, but the drinks were good!

The lobster mac & cheese was rich and flavorful. Lobster & crap stuffed mushrooms were magnificent. $6 happy hour mojitos didn't disappoint! The server was very personable and happily answered all our questions about the menu. I'm definitely coming back!!

I give this place 4 stars because the ambience is not what I expected, though the food was great. The decor reminded me of Red Lobster in the 80s - bright colors, tacky fish on the walls, etc. However, despite the decor, the garden salad with the house vinaigrette was so good. The dressing (a balsamic) was the best I have ever had, and the salad wasn't over dressed. My husband got the bread bowl of clam chowder - best I've ever had. It wasn't too creamy, wasn't fishy, and had a great smoky bacon flavor. The bowl soaked up the broth and was heaven to eat! I got the parmesan crusted tilapia with rice and broccoli. The salty parmesan complimented the mild flavored fish well. My husband got the shrimp tacos, and said he has had better. Overall, we were satisfied with our food choices.

We came here on our last night in Vegas, and what a fun place to be! The food was very prompt and AMAZING! Our waiter, Genaro, was so incredibly nice and accommodating. He was helpful with mojito suggestions. Definitely a must go if you're around Treasure Island.

Absolutey bad restaurant.  My husband ordered Clam Chowder soup (soup, for goodness sakes!) and it was VERY salty.  They gave him another one and it was still too salty.

I ordered Tuna Tartare and that was too salty as well.  I didn't bother asking for another plate. And we saw another guest return his food as well.

Perhaps it was just a bad night, but never again will we go back.

This review is specifically about the fabulous mojito bar attached to the front of the restaurant! The $8 mermaid (strawberry) mojito, classic blended margarita, and mango blended margarita were spectacular after watching a magic show nearby. (Nothing is $8 any more in Vegas, btw!!) The calamari app (ask for cocktail sauce instead of marinara) included jalapenos that were also breaded, and this was magical with the mango-rita! The nachos looked way better in the menu photo but tasted amaze (with some chicken thrown on for good measure)! Oh and regrettably I did not register the server's name (blaming the 'rita!!), but she was friendly, fast, and attentive, which made the visit even more enjoyable!  She also remembered the former employee who had referred our group to this place from another part of the Strip. Blissful pre-game for dinner later in the night; grateful good times with good friends!

Service and setting.  The restaurant was surprisingly empty at 6, and yet we had some trouble getting prompt service.  Our server was friendly, although a bit slow, although our water stayed full.  The manager stopped by as well, which was a nice touch.

Appetizer.  We ordered the crab and lobster stuffed mushrooms.  They were piping hot and had a lot of fish.  The sauce was a bit bland, but overall a good start.

Drinks.  The drinks were a high point.  I had the Gold Star and a Very Berry Mojito, and my wife had while sangria.  All three were really well made, and had nice flavor or without being overpowering.  

Main Dishes.  I had the blackened tuna.  The fish was cooked well and the seasoning was good.  The sides, pilaf and brussel sprouts we're solid, if unremarkable.

My wife had the snow crab legs, which was a large portion for the price.  The crab came out warm and the fixings were again solid, if nothing special.

Other thoughts.  This was a good experience overall, and we would come back.  It is pricey, given the Vegas strip markup, but not out of line e with other local options in this tier of restaurant.

Me and my family had dinner here on Thanksgiving night. The decor and atmosphere of the restaurant was something one would find in a cheesy seafood eatery on a Carnival cruise ship. My first thought was the sad bar they had at the front. When I have my seafood, I usually like to have a good quality beer with my meal. My first expectation of any expensive burger or seafood joint is a nice selection of brews on tap. Seafood Shack had only 4. No Guiness, Sam Adams, or Bass  for me. I stay away from the Budweiser, Miller, and other cheap beers.

Second, me and my brother ordered the clam chowder sourdough bread bowl. The soup had more ham flavor than clam. Personally, Progresso's clam chowder soup straight from the can tastes fresher than the soup we got. For $9, I'll stick to the clam chowder soup at Panera Bread.

We also ordered the fried calamari appetizer. For $12 dollars, I was expecting a decent platter to pass around. The portion size was quite pathetic and the batter for the calamari greasy and thin. For the same price, one can go to an Olive Garden and get 5-6 times the amount of calamari. When a pound of fresh squid can be had for under $5 at any seafood market, charging $12 for the 4-5 bite size portions we received was nothing short of a ripoff.

The main entrée I ordered was the fish and chips with scallops and shrimp. The portion size was average with the amount of fries quite low. The amount of fries compares to a McDonalds small to medium. The fish, shrimp, and scallops were cooked well but not worth $20. For $21, I can get a large fish and chips entree, an appetizer sampler of calamari, scallops, and shrimp, a fish taco, and coleslaw at the Pacific Fish grill restaurant at my local shopping center.

With the $400 plus bill my family had, we all could have gone to the Rio's seafood buffet instead. For seafood and beer not near the beach, I'll stick to Joe's Crabshack.

Max Power

After reading others reviews I was regretting having bought a Groupon for this restaurant but I bought it so I might as well use it. Not any of the bad comments happened to us. We were seated as soon as we walked in. Immediately they brought the glasses of water and took our appetizer order which was brought out in 5 minutes, immediately we ordered our main course, my hubby had the fishermans platter and I had the shrimp and calamari platter which they served to us in about 10 minutes. Everything was delicious and the portions are worth the price. We were totally stuffed that we couldn't have dessert. All in all from the moment we walked in, to being served, eat and pay our bill it was no more than. 35 minutes. Love this place,  can't wait for our next trip to Vegas

I ordered the Cajun seafood pasta and though it had great flavor the linguine was boiled at too high of a temp leaving it slimy outside and chewy inside almost pasty pasta. Good flavor but wasn't at all busy for them to make a simple mistake like that. They did offer to remake it but never like taking that chance. For 27.00 it should have been spot on for a pasta dish at least on the pasta the easy part. Leaving hungry, disappointed and $40 less in my wallet.

places like this in Vegas that have entrees for $25 to 30 serve very substandard food. I ordered a bowl of mixed seafood in tomato broth. It was all over cooked frozen seafood that was a bit fishy. I should have known better. Would have been better off saving money and having a hot dog around the corner

Coming into vegas after an 8 hour drive, one does not really want to venture too far from the hotel.

I checked into my room and decided to look at what the resort fee had in store for our stay.  

One of the deals was coming to seafood shack with a 2 for 1 entree.  Enticing indeed and my family decided to take on this offer.

The blackberry mojito is delicious,  there's the punch of alcohol with plentiful amounts of blackberry bits.

We also ordered the king crab and steak,  both of which were great. Especially given the fact we got one free.

The lobster mac and cheese was a little too saucey and not enough lobster bits.

Clam chowder bread bowl was great! Highly recommend this.  I'm however use to the sourdough bread so that part was a letdown for me.

The lobster beignets I was disappointed in,  not very beignet like.

All in all a great meal to start our trip off deliciously.

Every time I venture into TI, this location is home to a different restaurant. Now it is Seafood Shack. There's a bar area that is open to the casino. Gaming at the bar with comped drinks. Some low table seating for just grabbing an appetizer. Then behind the bar is the dining area. It's got a kitschy feel to it - very into the sea and fish theme. The menu isn't anything write home about. We got the crab cakes. They were small and not that great. No bad, but overpriced for what you got. Service was ok. Beer offerings were a step above the casino bars (they have two Alaska brewery offerings on tap). It's just a ho-hum, average, non-distinct restaurant. You could worse. But you could also do a lot better. If you are starving and don't to walk anywhere else, this place will do.

Service here leaves a lot to be desired. Wait staff watched me sit down and proceeded to carry on with their conversation for over 15 minutes and 24 seconds (I timed it as eye contact and a simple hello is one of my pet peeves) before another server walked over to greet me. I'd suggest Manangement take a closer look at their team. I now know why the place was empty on a Friday evening. I will say that the lady (she was leaving or going on lunch as I did not see her again) that greeted me was nice but the two other servers couldn't care less (one younger and one older) because they were being paid regardless...

My wife and I ate here only because our room included a buy 1 entree, get 1 free. 

The menu is limited and for what you pay you are better off spending you money elsewhere.

my meal was so poor.   I can't remember ever when I couldn't find lettuce in a Niçoise salad.  I asked for medium grilled tuna which they ignored.  The salad sure felt like it was pre-prepared and still in the refrigerator long before it came to my table.

My friend and I decided to have a meal at the Shack instead of Pho.  First time here and I have got to say, not to shabby.

Of course we started with an app, the Salad Nicoise.  I felt that it was very well made.  If you are a fan of olives, you will enjoy this bad boy.  My buddy and I did feel that the salt may have gotten away from the chef.  Over salted, but I didn't mind too much (maybe to request less salt next time).  The tuna was soft and you could taste the pepper snear.  Love the buttered bread they had on the side of the plate, but it gets soggy with the salad.  Our main course was the Clam Bake! That's right, go big or go home.. I thought it was very well made and presented.  I ordered a side of garlic fries to sweeten my meal.  Great addition.  Clams were huge and plenty of mussels.  Some sausages and corn.  The lobster was well baked in there and the sauce was just right.  Not over powering and I did not die of thirst = not much sodium! Bam!  I ended up having to ask for a togo box.. Sadly we lost.  

I had some desert, the carrot cake.  I have got to say, more carrot taste and less frosting.  I don't how everyone else likes it, but I prefer less frosting on anything.  Cake came out and it looked like an ice cream sandwich.  Pretty decent sized.  

Our server, very nice gentlemen.  Right out, he asked for our drink order, then came back several minutes later and asked for our app and came back later once again and asked for our main order.  Nice guy, came back with some bibs for our main entree and the table was prep with wet naps.  He came back with my refill before slurping the bottom.  He was on top of things, even my togo boxes, he made sure to double my box in case some of the sauce slipped through the first one.  

Environment, Great looking.  I thought it looked a bit Japanses from the top.  I like how it was secluded from the casino.  People dont watch you as they walk by.  Privacy! I like to lick my fingers! Don't judge me! 

Overrall I will come back.  There are plenty of other things to try and I would like to see if anything would change to add a start.. Hopefully not to take away one.
Good food. Good service.  Seven seas is "to die for ." Last night I ordered it and today, I'm craving for it

Wow couldn't imagine my foot being more tasteless. Over roasted tilapia was bland and it was served with boiled potatoes there were completely unseasoned no salt no pepper no butter that is just lazy. I have ate here before and it was pretty much the same deal. $10 bucks for a craft beer is a bit rich for such a inspiring place with no atmosphere.

My friends and I were walking around Treasure Island and decided to stop into this place for a bite to eat and some drinks.

We started out with the shrimp ceviche and crab cakes, we figured we couldn't go wrong with those orders.  To my surprise, these dishes blew my mind.  It wasn't just like any ordinary shrimp ceviche or crab cake, it was absolutely phenomenal. You can just taste the freshness of the shrimp and crab. We loved every last bite.

For my entree, I had the grilled shrimp and scallops special.  Again, I was very impressed with the fresh quality of food.  And the presentation was very detailed.

The manager, Matt, even came by our table to check on us and we ended up chatting with him for a few minutes. He was extremely kind. And so was our server, Kelly.

I give this place 5 stars on taste, service, and atmosphere. I'll definitely be coming back!  Oh and don't forget to try one of their mojitos, absolutely delicious!

The Skinny: lower than average food (2) with sh^&tty service (0) and stay away! stay far far away! (1).

Okay - confession. My hubs and I totally look for new places to try out in town on Eater Vegas. One of the more anticipated openings this month was Seafood Shack which replaced Isla, the Mexican restaurant in TI. So we checked out there website which advertised the BOGO entree promotion. SOLD! (I can't help it, I'm Asian and I can't help a good deal). We were going the first Tuesday of the grand opening.

So we were getting a table of 3 and I was the first to arrive. I got seated around 6:15 and waited for the rest of the party to arrive. The bus girl comes by, fills the water and leaves me alone. Fine. 

As my party trickles in, I still had no idea who my server was. By this time, it's around 6:50 before she decides to saunter to our table and even acknowledge our presence. Dead serious. No asking if I wanted a drink, no wondering if I wanted to order an appy or anything. Yeah. It was that bad.

I was watching her like a hawk too - she literally disappeared for a significant portion of the time unlike the other servers around the restaurant. We literally saw her once to take our order, once when our entrees came (she asked us how they were when we didn't even get a chance to take a bite), once to take the dessert order (which I had to flag her down -- she mumbled under her breath "in a minute") and three times finally to get our bill right.

Yeah, you guys heard me. Three fr$%king times to get the bill right. (She lost our BOGO coupon, neglected to take off a discounted item, gave us another person's bill -- I could've taken off with another dude's credit card --- yeah... that bad). That added another 30 minutes of playtime at the Seafood Shack.I was beginning to think it should be renamed Seafood Inn because at the rate we were going, I thought we might have to sleep in our chairs. We were stranded there for 2 hours. God forbid if you actually had show or something to catch.

Already the service (or lack thereof) would be enough to detract most people. Add to the fact that the food was subpar at best made the insult even more pronounced.

I ordered a crab louie salad which is not difficult to do well as long as the ingredients are good. The crab meat was severely below expectations. The crab was all macerated, and lacked the sweetness good quality meat. Added to the fact that there were bits of the clear shell and outer shell pieces mixed in, it was no es bueno. Throw in a few meally tomatoes and some rather generic thousand island dressing, you have yourself a sh*(ty experience for $16.95.

We ordered 2 orders of the fish and chips ($17.95) which were put apparently on the same plate for reasons unknown. That was annoying because we were out with a friend and he obviously didn't want to eat off of our plates. Plus, they only provided half of the serving of chips but double the fries. Not that the fries were that great to begin with but come on! The fish itself was greasy, overly battered and quite frankly nothing I would order again. Again, the tartar sauce was some generic stuff you could get at any grocery market.

Our pal ordered a clam chowder (comes in a bread bowl -$8.95) and the linguine with clams ($16.95) but neither was anything special according to him.

By now, I should have known better and quit while I was ahead. However, I am a sucker for key lime pie and noticed it was on the menu. So thinking that there had to be some sort of redeeming quality about this establishment, I ordered that to share with the hubs while our pal got an apple pie a la mode ($6.95 each).

Okay - let me get this straight - if your key lime pie is f%^king lime green, you know it came out of a box and that there's no freaking way there's any sort of real lime in there let alone, key limes. The oh-so soggy crust accompanied by the rather solid bright green filling from a generic Jello box was a full on textural assault and violation. Would not do this again. I noticed as well, our friend's apple pie - he left most of his pie crust on his plate and it looked like a limp doughy mass.

In general, I do not have a lot of one star reviews and I really hate writing one unless it is really really bad on all fronts. However, Seafood Shack - you've just +1'ed yourself in my 1 star club. (1 star review).
We come here for the Clam Bake!!! We make sure to eat here every time we are in Vegas.

We had the $7 dollar moijito and margaritas at the bar..the restaurant didn't open until 5pm. The bartender Syd was awesome. He was very attentive, knowledgeable and quick. The moijito at this place are very refreshing in the 102 degree weather. Definitely like this place

2017 Review 32/100

Pretty mediocre, particularly when you consider how many amazing food options there are on The Strip. My friend and I dined at Seafood Shack before catching Cirque du Soleil Mystère. We mostly picked this place because it was convenient to the theater in Treasure Island but, in the future, I would have an earlier dinner and pick a better spot.

There was nothing inherently bad about our visit. We sat at the bar with the intention of enjoying happy hour but ended up not doing so anyway. I wanted a simple glass of wine but their happy hour drinks were all beer and wells. The bartender was super, super friendly, regardless.

Our food was pretty meh. My friend had the Lobster Beignets. She wasn't impressed and she was pretty sure later on in the evening they were the cause of her feeling pretty sick. I had the Shrimp and Avocado Salad. Nothing spectacular. A salad with shrimp, avocado, and various other mixings. I didn't love it.

I recommend passing on this place. It's isn't inherently awful but there are so many better options in this city. You can do much better.
Best mojito, best crab legs and hands down best dinner in Vegas I've had!! I highly recommend coming here.

Tried this place in Treasure Island hotel for dinner one night. We had a coupon from resort for a free entree when one is purchased. I got the pasta with spinach and scallops and my coworker got the linguini and clams. Both dishes were good. The scallops were cooked perfect and cleaned well. My coworker enjoyed the clams. We both ordered our dinners with something special. He wanted the clams with wine sauce instead of red and I wanted my pasta with spicy cream sauce instead of lobster cream sauce. The waiter was very helpful and the kitchen very accommodating. They took the coupon with no hassle. We had a good meal for a very reasonable bill. Would go back.

Had the special restaurant week menu selection and it was lovely. The lobster beignets were crunchy outside and soft and full of lobster. Seafood pasta was cajun, so a bit spicy, but not overwhelming.  Key lime pie...incredible!  Would recommend!

The food and service was amazing!!! We ordered a chicken gumbo, beef filet with chipotle and New England lobster pan roast platter. Sergio our waiter was very attentive! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area.

Pretty good place. My boyfriend came in right when it opened for dinner and they were quick to seat us. Our waiter was so attentive and always made sure we had everything we needed. 

We started off with the calamari appetizer and it was average. I've had better and I've had worse. The major plus of this choice was that they definitely didn't skimp out on the portions. My boyfriend and I typically finish off a whole appetizer but we had plenty to spare with this one. 

Next I had the linguine and clams. There was a heaping amount of pasta and about 5 big clams in it. While there were only a few big clams they didn't skimp out on putting a bunch of little clams throughout it, which I actually liked better. I would definitely go back to this place just for this dish alone. 

Overall this place was pretty good but not amazing. I would recommend it if you're looking for something close by or you're looking for something not as pricey as the other restaurants around.

Came here using a Groupon. Husband had the ciopinni - delicious but a tad bit heavy on the salt, I had the shrimp and avocado salad - lots of shrimp, half an avocado, spicy dressing, very filling, my kid got the salmon which was okay but may not have not been the best choice since we are from Washington. However the side of mac n cheese that came with his salmon was the BOMB!  Prices are reasonable, relaxed atmosphere, great for families.
Went there last night after the show.   I have the fish and chips which cost $19.    They were good but not as good as I could have had at Captain D's for a lot less money.

Came in on a Friday night. It was moderately busy. The server was far less friendly or accommodating than the woman who was busing the tables. She actually came back a few times to bring us water and check on us. She also was the first nobody we talked to. 

I had the mussels and clams steamers. The sauce they were served in was flavorless and the crisp bread tasted like it was laying in an oil slick. My husband had the fisherman's player and added the lobster mac. The lobster mac was the saving grace and why this place got 3 stars instead of just 2. All of the items on the platter were encrusted with panko which gave it all a weird texture.

First let me say that I am a huge fan of mojitos so I was super excited to come here for one. 
since we were staying at Treasure Island, we were given a 2-for-1 cocktail voucher to use here which is awesome! 
We arrived at about 1130 pm on Monday 9-9-13 (don't judge us) and I sat at the bar while the guys I was with went to the restroom...
It took about 5 minutes for the bartenders to notice me and I wasn't even in a hidden spot or anything. Finally I asked if I could use the voucher towards two mojitos and before they answered me they laughed and mumbled something about me to each other. they obviously assumed they were both for me. My boyfriend and his brother came back and noticed that I wasn't happy and asked if I wanted to leave but I wanted my mojito damn it! 
The bartender had to ask me 3 times what it was I wanted because he had forgotten, and then even had to ask someone else how to make it. THEN he tried to tell me that what I had ordered wasn't on the menu and I literally had to point it out to him. 
after what seemed like forever, we got our drinks, and we were told 2 different total amounts. 
The people working here need to get it together. 
also, we didn't order any food, but the people behind us had some and it looked pretty questionable.

Stopped in here on my first ever trip to Vegas at age 28. Walked what seemed to be forever to get here and ordered the Cajun seafood pasta for 27 bucks a side of lobster Mac for 9 bucks and some clam chowder as a starter for 9 dollars. The chowder was tasty but was about a 1/4 cup service in a bread bowl. Our main order came out late and without our lobster Mac and cheese. When the meal hit the table, my lady friend literally said " seriously, is that it"!! There was one crawfish, two shrimp and a tiny slice of sausage. Taste like regular Alfredo and was horribly disappointing. Service was sub par but oh well it's casino food.  OFF TO GAMBLE MY FOOD SORROWS AWAY!!!

In a sea of pretentious and over-crowded Las Vegas restaurants, the Seafood Shack is an outpost of calm.  This place is like a TGI Friday's of decent seafood, with attentive staff, surprisingly good food and a pretty perfect location.

We were in Vegas for CES and (guess what?) at 7:00 on Thursday couldn't come up with an easy dinner reservation that wouldn't require corporate socializing...  quick search on OpenTable found the Seafood Shack.  Don't let the Treasure Island address fool you.  Would be easy to be dissuaded by its proximity to Senor Frog's or Gilley's, but the Seafood Shack delivers.  It's an easy walk from the center strip, and we were greeted friendily and taken right to our table.

Ordered tilapia tacos which were really delicious...  supple fish and just the right amount of cole slaw and aioli.  Also had shrimp ceviche which was tender and fresh...  and great chips.

Others at the table had gumbo which was "surprisingly delicious" and one of my colleagues even had a chicken sandwich which was pretty darn good.

Overall, this place was exactly what we needed and thanks for a really great experience.

This review is for the Mojito Bar located in front of the Seafood Shack and we were staying at Treasure Island Hotel and got a 2 for 1 drink at the Mojito Bar as part of our package.  The drinks were good, we ordered a Mermaid mojito and Cherry Breeze and the breeze was a bit on the sweet side.

While this place is a little on the pricey side, I would say it's worth it. Everyone in my party got a massive amount of food (including the snow crab dish which we were expecting them to skimp on). I got the shrimp platter and a side of Old Bay fries. The shrimp were huge and the fries were amazing. I also had the sangria which was just the right amount of sweet. The place itself was very clean and the decor was less cheesy than most seafood places I have been to.

Happy Hour Daily 3-6pm

Happy hour specials are $3-$6 drinks and $4-$6 apps.  Summer 2016 Seafood Shack has $7 Mojitos and Margaritas all day.  I started with the Siren Mojito and my friend had House Margarita.  Our bartender was ok.  Not very personable but got the job done.  For our second round I ordered a Strawberry Mai Tai and my friend had a Mango Margarita.  Drinks both rounds were perfect.  We didn't get a chance to order food because the kitchen didn't open until 3pm.  The food on the HH menu looks great.  I will be back to give it a try.
Food is awesome, service is fab! We are here for apps one night- fantastic!! Then ate for dinner it was incredible the crab stuffed shrimp was to die for! Best I've had! Must try

I visited this place with my Mom, didn't realize it opened at 5pm. Waited a while, they opened the place and sat us around 505.
I purchased the Seafood Shack Clam Bake and was excited-the place looked neat and the servers were friendly. 
It's Vegas so I didn't mind paying $80 for my Mom and I to get the most expensive thing on the menu, and I don't think I've had Maine Lobster before!
Since we were the first ones there we got served pretty quickly. The food looked nicely presented. When I dug in I realized the muscles were teeny-I mean, I've never seen such small muscles. The shrimp was so overcooked they were dark red and rubbery, the lobster was laughably small and overcooked as well. 
I was upset at being ripped off, we could have had a feast at Bacchanal for the same price but the people were nice and the service was quick.
WOULD NOT RECOMMEND, there's so much better on the strip.

Came here with family and the staff here are very friendly.  The food was very amazing.  Great seafood for being in the middle of the desert. Next time I'm in town I'll be back. Btw had the lobster burrito. .... Amazing! !!! Check it out.

Decided to try out this place since we got a coupon for buy one entree get one free.

Venue - Pretty cool they have a bar in front and the restaurant in the back with that seafood shack feel.

Service - Was seated right away and helped.  Server was very nice and quick.

Food :
Lobster Mac & Cheese - one of the best mac & cheese I evee had.
Crab Louie Salad - Large portion very good taste and filling.
San Francisco - Portion was large and everything on the plate was delicious.

 Recommended place but if you dont have any coupons it can be on the more expensive side.

I am n my husband staying in TI so they gave us 2 for 1 flyer , we decide to check it out since we was really hungry after tour . 
I order $37 plate of mixed seafood "seven seas" and he got "Cajun seafood pasta  " $24. Both entrees was defiantly worth of money  . My dish was flavorful with bunch of stuff in , and I tried his dish I liked as well , pasta had some nice Sauce and bunch of little crawfish tails in it , just be carefully for  jalapeño pepper ;) I bit one and my mouth was on fire ! 
Also got the mojito $6. And my husby got lemonade . So total bill was $78 and they minus second entree -$27. So for both we paid $51. Not bad .
The service was average . Ok I would say , nothing special , but the waiter was on top of what he doing . 
I liked this place! 
Recommend to try ;)

The food was top notch . I enjoyed the lobster salad. It was packed full with lobster.
At $25 it better be. My daughter had salmon with garlic Parmesan fries. Delicious and plated very well. We were very pleased and our server was awesome. The hostess had a bad attitude but I'm glad we stayed because it was a real treat.

Wanted have dinner with a group of friends 
And the decor of this restaurant is too cute 
Love all the colors and claw salt & pepper 
shaker. 
Must try their mojitos 

We had the following:
1. Fried calamari : average 
2. Fisher burger : not good and soggy fries 
3. Ahi salad was really good 
4. Mussel & claim combo was good 
5. Shrimp & avocado salad  
Overall will definitely come back again and try some other dishes

Good food for a late night dinner. The salmon was very good and came with broccoli and a very good pilaf, lemon and butter. The snow crab legs were very meaty and tasty. The Potato was pretty basic.

Overall lots of food and very impressive. We used the 2-for-1 for staying at TI. Highly recommended you do the same for even MORE value!

The happy hour is the best value in Treasury Island.  I'm not a big nachos guy (my girlfriend is), but the happy hour nachos are truly good, with some pulled pork and plenty of cheese to cover up the chips--not skimpy on toppings like many nachos.  We came back and had the half clam bake--good value on fresh seafood there.

Great meal and drinks! We had a 2 for 1 coupon, but would definitely come back and pay full price! I had the linguine and clams and it was amazing! My husband had the pan roasted scallops and really enjoyed them. We both had the mermaid monitors and loved them!! Service was very friendly and the atmosphere was pleasant.

I was really disappointed about our experience at seafood shack. We came here to dine one night after feeling too tired to cook something. The experience started with NO HOST at the entrance -- hmm, are we suppose to seat ourselves? But why do they have a host booth? Finally someone came to help us get settled. I requested for a table with booth since our kids manage to fall off any regular chair whenever we're at a restaurant coz of their non-stop playing while waiting for the food. The spacing between tables were TOO CLOSE. You could literally hear the next table's conversation even if you don't intend to do so. We were given menu but the waiter too forever to get our order because he was too busy flirting with a bunch of customers who came in way later than we did. When he did finally get our order, he was in so much hurry. I had to ask him to repeat what I said just to make sure he got what I ordered. 
The waiting time was OKAY. But guess what, the other table who came later & ordered later than we did GOT THEIR FOOD FIRST! Really dude?! Really..I wanna just get up and leave but I we waited too long & too hungry to leave. Thinking the food was gonna be good, we stayed -- but IT WAS A DISASTER!! Man! We should've just walked away!! My pasta was too salty & the steak was too tough. Our son's tilapia with pilaf rice & the 2 dozen raw oysters were the only decent food on the table. I am never going back again. Staff needs to get retrained on proper costumer care & HOW TO PRIORITIZE clients. Prices were too steep for the quality of food we ordered. Stay away. Too overrated.
The service is here is super quick and the food is great. I got scallops that were tasty that was seasoned well.

Located inside Treasure Island this is another spot we would not have tried if we hadn't recieved a BOGO coupon with our stay at TI.  This is a pretty good sized bar and restaurant with plenty of seating and full service bar.

We tried a mermaid mojito (strawberry) which was delish and SS offers lots of different mojitos all for $8.  Since mojito's are our favorite alcoholic poison this was a good thing for us.  We tried two of the seafood pan roasts one with a creamy New England cream sauce and the other with a spicy tomato sauce.  Both roasts came with mussels, clams, scallops, shrimp and 1/2 lobster on top of rice pilaf.  I preferred the New England Cream sauce but both were quite tasty and while they were a tad pricey at $36.95 they were a great deal at BOGO!  

Service was good and if we get our hands on some more BOGO offers we will  definitely be back to try some more seafood goodness.

Came here using a $40 Groupon. We got the clam chowder in a bread bowl, crawfish and blackened red snapper. The clam chowder was on par with what you find in Boston! The crawfish was amazing! We wanted more bread to sop up the broth! I would've given 5 stars but the blackened red snapper was sooooo bland. Maybe the chef was tired since we were one of the last customers.

Came on a Thursday afternoon with a Groupon.  We were seated immediately.   Service was excellent.  Ordered the Crab Louie - lots of crab, but it didn't wow me.  No flavor whatsoever to the crab.  Friend who dislikes seafood ordered the steak.  They were thoughtful about asking to butterfly the steak to meet her needs and our need to catch a flight.   Food was only okay.  Good value with Groupon, but I wouldn't want  to pay full price as the taste was just not there.  I did really like the look of the restaurant and want to give a great big shout out to fantastic service.  Would I return?  Probably not.

We came here for a snack... not quite a meal... and ended up ordering the lobster and corn fritters, corn chowder, lobster mac and cheese and a side of fries.

Lobster and corn fritters were good but missing the lobster taste I was expecting. However, I would order them again. Their crispy outside and soft inside was really enjoyable and the sauce was really flavorful.

Corn chowder was a great deal! Huge portion in a bread bowl for around $8.

Fries were delicious! Make sure to get some.

The lobster mac and cheese was very lacking on lobster and for the price tag, not worth it.

Pricey for the food but a solid option for food at Treasure Island.

I also got one of those 2-for-1 coupons and we decided to check this place out. We were greeted by a pale and bored looking pregnant girl who seemed to hate being there and looked pretty sour the entire time we were there.

Our waiter was great, very upbeat and positive. I was suprised how modest the place was considering the entree prices go up to $45 / person. It's basically a cafeteria style setup with no privacy between tables - modest chairs and tables. No booths. You can hear everything people seated next to you are saying.

I decided to order salad nicoise with seared tuna and greens. The taste was ok but for some reason I had hard time digesting it for the rest of the night. I wouldn't say it made me sick, but the food sat in my stomach and it kind of killed the mood for the rest of the night as I didn't feel like doing anything else except staying still and waiting. Maybe the salad was too oily.

In any case, even with the 2-for-1 coupon, I don't think this place is worth it. Too many better dining options near by.

Great experience and value that exceeded expectations!!

Drinks, food, service, and ambiance were all high quality! The Seafood Shack was managed well and staff operated in a first class manner.

On Saturday evening, the Seafood Shack was so busy that we could not get in. This was a good sign and we returned on Sunday evening. They were less busy and we were immediately seated. 

We had purchased a $20 Groupon for $40 off of the bill without restrictions. (We have a strong preference for Groupons that do not restrict the selection). We had two cocktails each, shared two appetizers, an order of blackened crab legs, and desserts.

Our server (Fernando) was very professional! Throughout the meal, he provided just the right amount of attention! Likewise, the General Manager (Matt) stopped by our table and was very gracious.

The cocktails were perfect. My date had a couple of Super Mojitos and I had two martinis. They were tasty and served quickly after ordering. 

Our appetizers were the seafood stuffed mushrooms and crab cakes. Both appetizers were freshly prepared and served on hot plates.  We shared an order of blackened crab legs which were extraordinarily good. This was plenty of food for the two of us. 

The next time we are in Las Vegas, we will enjoy another meal at the Seafood Shack.

My friend and I ate here because we had a two-for-one coupon. Our meal was pretty good - My shrimp tacos were ok and she liked the burger. Our drinks were just ok and the service was poor. 

For example, on the night we ate here we stopped by to ask what our coupon would pay for. The hostess confirmed what it covered and we went upstairs to get changed. When we got back down about twenty minutes later we were informed there was a one-hour wait. It would have been helpful if the hostess had let us know that the wait was one-hour the first time I spoke with her so that we could put our name on the list. 

Then, we sat down at the bar and played the machines while we waited for drinks and dinner. When we were charged for our drinks I asked the bar tender if drinks were complimentary because we were gambling. (This is standard in Vegas, and the couple next to us confirmed their drinks were free. They had put in 20s and were "pretending to play" so they could get their drinks for free.) The bar tender very curtly responded, "They're free if you're following the rules." I asked what the rules are and he responded, "Look" as he pointed to my machine. There was no sign on my machine explaining any rules, which he saw, and so he pointed to the sign on another machine and said, "You have to bet at least $1 every single time to get a free drink," though the sign said "an average bet of $1." I didn't want to argue, but it was quite rude and stingy, in my opinion.

Pros:
- Food ok
- Convenient location
- Coupon at checkin

Cons:
- Rude staff

Visited March 2013

My husband & I decided to eat hear on a whim. We both really enjoyed it. I got the herb crusted tilapia & was very impressed. He got the blackened tilapia & it was very good as well. We ordered the coconut shrimp but they forgot to bring it. The waiter was very apologetic & offered a free desert to make up for it. We were full by the end of dinner so we passed on it.

My husband and I sat at the bar and received good service from Marc. The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable about the food and the drinks. I had the shrimp and avocado salad  and my husband had their daily special. My salad was delicious, it's nice knowing that the dressing was made in house. My husband had their pasta special, I didn't get to eat it but it had shrimp, scallops and lobster.  he can't eat dairy so he tried it with their cioppino sauce. He was very happy that they could accommodate him. We did not have dessert but their drinks were good, I really liked their strawberry mojito. My husband liked the wine selection, which seemed to be fairly priced. A good experience and worth a try.

Not terrible prices by Las Vegas strip standards. Made a reservation on a Friday night, but didn't end up needing one. If you are on the strip, near Treasure Island, and don't want something too fancy, or with long waiting,  it is worth it. Kitchen forgot to make our appetizer. The manager sincerely apologized.

After a bit of disappointment, finding out the Mexican restaurant was closed, we were pleasantly surprised with the change to seafood.

The clam chowder was excellent.    We had the poke appetizer and  Cioppino for dinner and they had a scallop special that should be on the menu every day.  The cioppino was flavorful and the scallops were NOT overcooked, which we have found in many seafood restaurants.

We had good service from Genaro, that is critical to us as we have had terrible service in some places on the strip.

A good effort from all involved.  Let's hope they keep pressing the service issue.

This one is a keeper.

After finally tracking down the Seafood shack/Mojito Bar, I was excited for a $6 Mojito during their happy hour. 

Unfortunately, our bartender had some irritated-like attitude that I didn't really appreciate. 

Personally, I think that If you can't act the part of a fun or outgoing bartender, maybe you shouldn't be one? 

Mojito wasn't very strong, but still decent. Service of course, wasn't the best... but I would probably return if a different bartender was there.

Ordered the coconut shrimp = was missing salt
With fries= think they gave me the left overs of the frier :-/
New England clam chowder = good!
Lobster mac n' cheese = good!
Rainbow trout = good!
Service was great (little slow) but everything is made fresh so I understand takes its time. I recommend to bring the 2 for 1 coupon that you get when you check in! Won't regret it!!!!!!

If you're staying at Treasure Island, don't forget to use your buy 1 entrée get 1 50% off! We forgot to use ours and were so annoyed. In any case, we only came to eat here since we were tired from the flight and didn't want to trek too far for food that night. It wasn't busy on a Thursday night in June, and we didn't need reservations for a party of 6 to be seated right away. However, they are on Opentable, so it's always a safer bet to make reservations anyway, and you get your points! On our visit we tried:

-Shrimp & Avocado Salad (Avocado Stuffed w/Citrus-Guajillo Shrimp, Corn Relish, Chipotle Aioli, $14.95, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/seafood-shack-las-vegas?select=yXGp_kvd1cBMGX34ZdgoLw#yXGp_kvd1cBMGX34ZdgoLw): Pretty good, and you get a huge portion for the price. I would actually order this again if you're looking for a healthier option.
-Lobster Cobb (Maine Lobster, Served on Chopped Romaine, Bacon, Hardboiled Egg, Tomato, Spicy Adobo Dressing, $24.95, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/seafood-shack-las-vegas?select=yXGp_kvd1cBMGX34ZdgoLw#hoA3w0qtY3110U2-Wlmksg): Also a huge portion, and you get a decent amount of lobster. However, I don't think I would pay this much again for a salad.
-Lobster Roll (Celery, Tarragon, Chives, Light Dressing, Toasted Brioche Bun, Served w/Fries, $24.95, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/seafood-shack-las-vegas?select=yXGp_kvd1cBMGX34ZdgoLw#F5wg172qg4YzGOzFhekkHQ): Just ok- I thought this was on the bland side. The fries were pretty good though.

Service was really slow, and it took a while for our server to come by, then a while for our food to come out, then awhile for us to get our check and pay, etc. Unless I was desperate for a place to get a quick meal while staying in TI (and had a coupon), I don't think I would come back.

Meh is right.
