I was here because I had people in from out of town, and well, we just happened upon it.  

The prices are ridiculous, though I understand because it's in a major resort, but really, if you're going to price-gouge me at least give me decent service. 

The server was less than pleasant and really looked like he was being inconvenienced by, y'know, serving people.  Thanks guy. 

The food is... meh.  There was New England clam chowder, lobster stuffed mushrooms, and cajun fried shrimp.  It was on par of a Joe's Crab Shack.  Yeah... again, meh. 

Would I come back? Not unless the out-of-towners desperately wanted to return.

I visited the seafood shack a couple weeks ago and in one word I'll say that place was garbage. ..... the food was delicious but the bartender who was serving us acted like he was going out of his way to even say hi. ... we never redirected a tell on our drinks. ... I resorted to leaving the restaurant and getting a beer at the local convenience store. .... if that bartender I believe his name was Richard was fired and you hired the lady from the convenience store my experience would've been a 10 instead my experience is a 2

Pretty good food and location for Treasure Island.  The portions were good size and for Las Vegas the prices were very reasonable.  The menu was large and there was a good selection of drinks.  The service was also good which is often rare in a casino setting.  Only reason for three stars is because most entrees don't come with sides standard and tends to be a la cart.  Overall it is the best food in Treasure Island.

Slow service even on a dead Monday, however it was worth the wait.  After so many disappointments in Vegas it was nice to have some decent food.  It wasn't perfect but close.  I got the Fisherman's platter and She got a Lobster Roll.  The worst was the overcooked, cold lobster on her roll even if the flavors were nice.  Everything on my plate was spot on except the Shrimp, only slightly over done.  I was disappointed in the portion size more than anything else even for Vegas.

We went based on yelp reviews. What were you people thinking? You've got to be kidding me #1 in Las Vegas. Are the other reviews real? What a shame. There must be better places for seafood. Small place about 20 tables. Put my wife in a very bad mood. We expected so much more. Best thing was the salt and pepper shaker claw (simple pleasures); marginal crabcakes, adobo shrimp taco was good, french fries (actually very good). Las Vegas fresh fish was bad. Fishy. Lobster roll was so poor our partner did not even finish. They were overwhelmed; very cold if you know what i mean.either frozen and thawed out or just plain.. I would bet because of the reviews (are they for real?); they do take reservations. Very busy with outside that jammed up the seating area and made for poor atmosphere. People serving seemed very nice but were always putting out fires going in many seemingly disoriented directions. Which resulted in poor service. Bathroom (one in place) is right outside holding a sealed wall did not work well. Will never go back. Life is too short. Vegas has a lot of seafood place go somewhere else.

Giving two stars because the good was actually great but the service was TERRIBLE! Then on top of being terrible they were rude about it!!! The server took for ever to greet us then took forever to get our order. Then once we got our food my boyfriend didn't realize his food came with guacamole so he asked if he could get it without and the sever snatches the plate and rudely says, "you didn't tell me". If he had waited a second, we know he didn't!! But regardless that's not how you approach guests. Then we ask for a manager who is no help at all!! After our complaint our server decides to serve every table around us and not check on us. Again we decide to complain and this time the manager is rude. During our complaint he snatches the bill and says okay fine I'll take care of the bill. That's not what we complained for. It was bc he needed to be talked to about his behavior and clearly so does the manager!!

The restaurant decor is fun, but the service is mediocre and so is the food. Our server wasn't friendly at all. He barely spoke to us. The shrimp & fries were so greasy--bleh. The biggest disappointment was the coleslaw. It tasted like that prepackaged grocery store stuff and was so runny/watery. I couldn't even eat it. Very disappointing meal. At about $30 a plate, this place needs to step up its game, big time. We definitely won't be back. There's so many better options within a stone's throw!

Chewy lobster and pathetic sides is not my idea of a good meal. The "red" potatoes were boiled whole, until they were no longer red and then plopped on the plate with a few sogged out Brussels sprouts. We got my son the "coconut" shrimp but it didn't have any coconut! Must have run out? But they didn't tell us. Save your money, go somewhere else.
Food and service was good. Having lived on west coast of Florida the key lime pie was ok compared to what I expected. If you want great key lime pie you have to make it to the Grand Lux in Venetian.

This trip was our second time at the restaurant. Last time we'd had a pleasant time and with the 2 for 1 coupon you get for staying at the hotel, it's almost a no brainer. We ordered the crab cakes to start, which were flavorful and the Chipotle sauce on the side had the perfect amount of heat to it. For our meals we had the Cajun Pasta and Shrimp Tacos, both of which were delicious! Slow drink service kept this from being a 5 star review, but otherwise we had a great time!

Wow! That was seriously the best meal I've had in a VERY LONG TIME! I had the filet mignon with a crisped potato, brussel sprouts and bacon, and mushrooms all drizzled with a chipotle Gorgonzola sauce. I don't usually get impressed with food, but these chefs made everything taste delicious (even the things that aren't that great tasting normally). My fiancé even commented on how I actually finished my meal (I never do that!). I will definitely come back here.

Food Snob? No, but when in Vegas you expect a certain level of goodness. This placed missed the mark! I will say that the stuff mushrooms were delicious! That was the only thing! We tried the fisherman's platter and the adobo shrimp tacos! Both sucked! The fried food was almost black, taste like they used old oil. Tacos were flavorless. Service was lacking also, wait was longer than it needed to be for food and to close out the tab. Will not be back!

This place is located in Treasure Island. We were at treasure island to catch the Mystere show and decided to stop by the Seafood Shack for some dinner. We were both very pleasantly surprised! Only complaint is that the waitress took pretty long to come to our table but I know she was dealing with another table who was giving her some trouble. Once she did come she was very pleasant and good at what she does. The menu is decently big with lots of options. We ended up ordering a salmon dish and the lobster tacos. My boyfriend said the salmon was one of the best he's ever had. My lobster tacos were absolutely phenomenal. They came with a small side salad with delicious dressing. Atmosphere was nice and nautical. Prices weren't too bad. I think we ended up paying around $50 for both meals. I'd definitely recommend it and will be going back next time I'm in Vegas!
Very quick service, delicious food, reasonable price. I had my least meal here as a single lady so I will definitely remember this restaurant.

We came here on a Friday night around 8pm and it was not packed.  My BFF and I shared a fisherman's platter and a pan roast New England style (Sea Scallops, Shrimp, Clams, Mussels, and 1/2 Maine Lobster,braised and served with rice pilaf).  The pan roast items sat in a bed of delicious clam sauce.  We started dipping our fried items from the fisherman's platter in the New England clam sauce and was very delighted.  The fisherman's platter would not have been as good if we didn't have clam sauce.  The Cole slaw that came with the fisherman's platter was nothing to rave about, nor were the red and white sauces.  The scallops on the fisherman's platter were SO PLUMP and HUGE and JUICY.  Oh my!  

We were very happy considering that we used a Groupon.  Might we come back?  Only with a Groupon considering there's so much good food and buffets in Vegas.

My wife and split the Pan Roast with the lobster mac and cheese. We were really happy we split a meal and the food was excellent. The sauce we choose was the New England and it had so much flavor, the waiter brought us bread just so we could finish the sauce, too. Speaking of the waiter; he was excellent! Some of the best service we have had on Vegas. 

The only thing we were a bit disappointed with was the drinks. We ordered their top shelf margarita (on the rocks) and we could definitely taste the upgraded tequila, we believe they still used sour mix. We were hoping it would be a true margarita. All in all though, they were still fairly good. We would definitely go back.

The mojitos were awesome. My boyfriend had a regular and I had a strawberry mojito. Normally I stick to margaritas but I was happy with my choice. Typical happy hour margaritas have shitty tequila, but these ones came with premium tequila. We also split a shrimp and fries basket and they were delicious!

This place is great for yummy seafood. I enjoyed the delicious new England pan roast with no mussels. It was so yummy. The lobster was a half of a relatively small lobster but it was still absolutely yummy. My husband had the stuffed salmon and said it was absolutely delicious. The service was great as well!  Our server was very attentive.  

TIP**make sure that you have the buy one get one free entree coupon you must have it to get the discount.

Love this place! The shrimp ceviche is delicious and I know a good ceviche. The calamari is nice and fresh. The seafood linguine is amazing. Not to mention that Sergio the bartender makes one BOMB MOJITO! Been drinking his drinks for 11 years now! The Seafood Shack has a great menu and the quality of the food is great. Never a bad time at this bar not a bad drink.

It was great experience at the Seafood Shack in Vegas. I went here in early November '12 and it is now January '13 and I still remember this experience clearly. It's right in the Treasure Island hotel so it was a perfect dinner spot.  I purchased a Groupon not knowing how this place would be, but I'm very glad that I did.  The portions they give are generous and price is reasonable. 

I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl with garlic fries on the side.  I definitely did not need the extra fries because my boyfriend ordered some lobster roll and it came with garlic fries. My eyes were big when I ordered haha.  Also, we had this friendly Asian waitress that was working by herself, yet she always came at the right times. I was surprised at the awesome service this lady gave us.  She delivered our food in a timely manner, helped us with the menu, and even suggested my lemonade alcoholic beverage.  I loved it btw.  My favorite drink while I was there.

I'm sure we'll be back on our next trip to Vegas and I hope it'll be another great experience.

So the only minus to this review is the smoke from the casino. The staff here have no control over that so we won't waste time giving any negative publicity from that.
So we started on the wrong foot coming into the restaurant, we saw no hostess and decided to seat ourselves. Wrong move... They moved us.(our fault we came in the back way)
Ok so let's start this correctly now. We were seated in Fernando's section. He's very friendly and inviting, we'll come back to him later. We ordered our drinks and took our time checking over the menu. My daughter decided to get adventurous and ordered the shack burger. I know right a kid having a burger for the forth day in a row... Who knew?
My wife finally decided on the herb and Parmesan crusted tilapia. The fish was cooked perfectly, the rice pilaff was delicious and the vegetables were tender and tasty.
I decided on the coconut shrimp platter. The shrimp was delicious and cooked perfectly, the coleslaw was almost as good as the shrimp. I'm starting to get sick of fries. Needless to say I'm not taking responsibility for the fact that I didn't eat all my fries.
Dessert time arrived and my wife ordered the key lime pie with a tea. I finally took the plunge and ordered a mojito. Nothing special just the traditional mojito. I also had the key lime pie. The pie was fantastic! A dessert lovers paradise. It had no chocolate but with a pie that fantastic chocolate isn't needed. The marshmallow topping was a bit much for me though. For a place that advertises that it's a mojito bar I think it's a must try. 
So Fernando, what a class act! He was great! I can say without a doubt that he was the nicest person we've met in this whole hotel. He was patient while we looked at all our choices. There was was no rush at anytime from him. He checked up on us during dinner asking if anything was needed. The rest of the meal he left us alone and reminded us that if there was anything extra at anytime he would be happy to help. The meal finished and as busy as he was... Keep in mind this restaurant was full and only Fernando and one other man were working the floor. We were stuffed and hardly able to move in our chairs, he was happy to accommodate us in the dessert, tea and mojito. He was such a friendly warm person we tipped fantastically and he was worth every penny of it. As well we wrote on the receipt about how pleased we were with him. Hopefully management sees the comment from us. At this point I think our sever Fernando was even better than the meal we had. 
Fernando thanks for the exceptional service! You've made our evening!

If you're eating here, it's probably due to some combination of:
1) Convenience 
2) Desperation 
3) The 2-for-1 entree coupon you get from staying at TI

- Service was slow and inattentive, despite there not being many diners. 
- My plate came out not entirely clean. 
- The food (cioppino and seared scallops) wasn't cooked terribly, but it just tasted so weird. Like some of the seafood wasn't seasoned enough, or tasted really fishy. Even the rice pilaf had kind of a weird buttery sauce. As a huge seafood lover, I was super disappointed. 
+ The waitress brought us a little extra bucket of bread to soak up the tomato broth when we asked. 

Honestly, the bread was my favorite part of the meal. That's kind of sad. 

Even if you're staying at TI, just do yourself a favor and walk across the street to anywhere other than here.

The price was in line with other resort restaurants in the strip, the quality of the food wasn't. My lobster stuffed salmon was okay - the lobster stuffing, rice and sauce were good, but the salmon itself was pretty dry. Even if I find myself back at TI, there are too many good restaurants in the same price category with much better food!

we had the $59 special.  lobster and filet mignon.  the lobster was good but a lil overcooked.  the filet cut smoothly and had good flavor.  loved the truffle parm fries fries and the roasted veggies.  The mermaid mojito was pretty good too.  not bad for the price. atmosphere was friendly and service was good.

Stayed one night in Treasure Island and decided to try Seafood Shack. The menu offered a reasonable choice and the service was good but the food was mediocre and overpriced for the poor quality. My fries were overcooked and the breaded fried fish pieces too dry. I would not eat here again.

Since my group and I had time to kill before heading to a nearby club and we were hungry, we decided on this place. Nothing too fancy about it and for seafood, the prices were acceptable for Vegas. I ordered the fish and chips- not bad...but I have had better. It lacked taste which the tartar sauce and vinegar made up for. My wife ordered a scallops and rice dish and no joke her rice tasted burnt- mind you, all of us at the table tasted it before we said something. Usually she won't complain unless it's not edible- it must have been the bottom of the rice pot where rice is left to die a burned death. They didn't comp her food or even suggest a free dessert- hmm. 

The plus to this place? Calamari. They did offer a lot which has been unusual in most of the places I frequent.

I had the Lobster Cobb salad which was good but the lobster in the salad wasn't very good. My husband had the Cajun seafood pasta; it was really good but the bread was just kind of stale and it smelt old. The waiter was very careless. He kept forgetting my straw and while receiving my meal he didn't give me any silverware. Overall the service was OK and the food was mediocre.

*** Review is for Restaurant Week 2015 menu ***

I had an early reservation here because I was going to see Mystère after dinner and I wanted to give myself plenty of time.  I was seated in short order and was brought menus and water.  I ordered iced tea and that was quickly brought, too.

My server took my order.  I then sat for twenty minutes and no lobster beignets were brought.  At the end of that that twenty minutes, a runner appeared with the beignets in a cast iron container.  The container was not hot and the beignets were not hot.  There was some lobster in the beignets.  There was a fair amount of filler, but I expected that given the price.  Before I was finished with my appetizer, I was brought my main course, the Cajun seafood pasta.  This has become a theme during my Restaurant Week meals--courses that run into one another because someone is not paying attention.  I think the beignet was done and was sitting under a heat lamp somewhere and someone realized I hadn't gotten mine yet.  If it took them twenty minutes to make the beignets, that was 16 minutes too long.  

The Cajun seafood pasta is described on the menu as "linguine tossed with shrimp, crawfish, crab, Cajun sausage."  There was little Cajun flavor.  There were a fair number of shrimp and a little crab, but I tasted nothing to indicate the sausage rounds were anything near Cajun.  It was regular sausage with not much flavor.  In the end, the pasta would best be described as just OK.

Dessert was certainly the star of this meal.  The individual carrot cake was quite tasty and the portion was very large.  The one drawback was the marzipan carrot--it was so hard I could have hurt someone if I through this at them.

Service was less than OK.  I've mentioned the run on courses above so I won't belabor that point.  This was an OK place to try during RW, but it's not somewhere I'd return.

slow service!

The food was great but the service was slow! I had the Fish and Chips... I think they were still trying to catch the cod fish or something... the wait was ridicuously 30 min long that we almost walked out of there... they should know that it's Las Vegas and people flock to restaurants and opt to dine out especially on a weekend so they should be prepared and have a full staff especially when there's an event going on in Vegas... luckily, we still made it out on time for the main event at Mandalay Bay... I guess I can't complain much, this was a Groupon deal, which I should've printed, the app took forever to come up (signal is low inside the restaurant) Boo! :(

This restaurant is located in the Treasure Island Casino and open only for dinner... we tried eating there for lunch. Bar was open though...

Review #0132

Not terrible but not great. My husband really enjoyed his meal, the new england style pan roast. I tried a couple bites and it was tender and tasty. I ordered the lobster tacos which were sadly chewy and way over done. I didn't even get one piece that resembled an actual piece of lobster, I would liken it more to small chopped up shrimp. Again, not a terrible place but don't bother paying $28 for lobster tacos.

This restaurant sits in the back corner in the Treasure Island casino and I discovered it purely by accident and must admit that I was impressed. The shrimp ceviche appetizer is a must, it was very good. My shrimp taco was also very tasty but I was disappointed that the chef opted to use baby shrimp instead of grilled prawns, that's kind of cheap. The grilled trout was also good but a little over cooked. None the less, you  get a tasty meal for almost a reasonable price. The service was also very good.

Despite the cruddy reviews below, I had several good happy hour experiences recently. Note- happy hour only and prefeably while milking a twenty in the video poker machines at the bar a few free Tanquery and Tonics. I ate the Ahi Poke on three occasions and the hot wings on a couple- both were very good.

I stayed at Treasure Island for the first time earlier this month and got a nice 2-for-1 entree coupon at Seafood Shack, along with a 2-for-1 cocktail coupon at any of the places within TI (including Seafood Shack) as part of our room benefits.

Let's just say I used both of these in the same meal and had 2 $35 entrees and 2 $10 cocktails for $50 pre-tip. I thought I couldn't handle it so I texted some friends saying they should join if they come by in time. Good thing they didn't because I devoured it all.

The Lobster Stuffed Salmon was really good and I would definitely recommend getting it, as long as you aren't on a no carb diet like my friend. Sucker. I got the New England style Pan Roast as my second dish and it was good, but not worth its $35 price tag in terms of quantity. But with the coupon it's not bad.

Drink recommendation per the waiter was Blackbeard's Love Potion, which he said sounds/looks deceiving because it is pure alcohol. Tastes sweet but has only alcohol in it.

Oh I also added a key-lime pie to top it off, which is worth trying as well! I would have gone for the carrot cake but I felt that going into the 3000 calorie range for one meal would be a bit excessive. Next time.
We had the main lobster and king crab, both were excellent.  Vegetables were cooked perfect and super yummy. Try it out, really good food

This place has become one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. The food was incredibly good, the staff was nothing but courteous, and the prices were fair for the amount of food we had. We will be returning here the next time we're out this way.

We made a reservation for this place but there was no need to, as the place was dead. To be dead on the strip at 7:00pm on a Saturday night should have been the first clue. We were pressed for time so we decided to stay. The hostess was snotty and off putting, the service was okay and the food was.... Fishy!  Freshness at a seafood place is a must. This did not smell or taste fresh. What a disappointment.

Great service and great food! We loved the plain nachos - the cheese was sooooo good. The chef, Phil, came out to ensure the nacho cheese was ok for our friend who has allergies - I've never experienced this level of service, and I've eaten out for years. Additionally, Kellie was our waitress, and she too was very attentive to our needs. Great experience and highly recommended!

Beware if you're not using cash!!!

If I could give no stars I would. Went here for a drink and dinner with my husband. We had coupons so everything came out to under $19.49, tip included. Checked my online banking account the next day and see that they are holding a charge of $226.08. WTF?!?!  Called everyone under the sun only to be transferred and then transferred and then sent to a voicemail. Lets see how long the manager takes to call us back.

From now on I'll be avoiding all restaurants in the T.I.

The food here is good. Good place to sit and have a nice seafood meal. The portion size is large for being a seafood place. I had fish and chips which was great and also tried their seafood platter which was good but lacked a bit on flavor.

Gotta say, love this place. I wish we had asked our servers name, but she was very friendly and really wanted us to have a good experience. I got the scallop pasta. It was delicious. A bit saucy, but I like that. A little spinach, some sundried tomatoes, and a cream sauce. About 6 scallops rounded it out. My hubby got a fish sandwich and really enjoyed it. We ordered the bucket of 10 coronitas to enjoy withour meal and take the rest back to our room. The food was good, the service was great, and I highly recommend this joint.

We went to the Seafood Shack for dinner before Mystere.  I was surprised how much we enjoyed it.  The ambiance does not match the food.  I feel the food is much more upscale.  The lobster stuffed salmon was delicious. My husband enjoyed the seven seas dish. He is a fisherman and kept commenting how fresh everything tasted.  We will definitely be back.

I was at this place on a Saturday evening around 7:00 PM. We had a reservation but still had to wait too long to get seated at our table.  The food I give a mixed review and the service was average. We had a waitress that was helping our waiter and she was very confused and made some of us feel very annoyed. She kept bringing food to the table and then realizing it was for another table and then picking it up and taking it away and did this 3 times. She also was not friendly and did not even speak to anyone to explain her actions. She had a scowl on her face that was unpleasant. The waiter was good but we had to ask for refills and he could have been better at monitoring the needs of our table.  THE FOOD:  We had appetizers that were very good. The Calamari was excellent tasting and fried to perfection, However the Tomato Basil sauce was not a good fit for the Calamari dip.  The Lobster and Crabmeat stuffed Mushrooms was also excellent and the Mornay sauce inside was perfect. For a main course I had the Cajun Seafood Pasta. This was a Linguini tossed with shrimp, crab, crawfish, cajun sausage, green onions, red bell pepper, and jalapeno in a cream sauce. THIS IS NOT A CAJUN DISH. A cajun dish would have more Crawfish, shrimp, and andouille sausage that are cut in bigger pieces and this dish contained two very thin cut pieces of a western sausage.  The aromatic vegetables green bell pepper, onion, and celery were overcrowding the dish and there was no flavor of cajun spices. It actually upset my stomach. My wife had the Grilled Salmon with vegetables and rice.  The Salmon was cooked to perfection and tasted great. The brussel sprouts were very bitter and someone did not have any idea how to cook them. The rice was cooked well.  The ambiance of the place was just ok because the staff were rushing around so much that it killed the mood a little.  I probably would not eat at this place again and especially with a large group. They seem to get overwhelmed easily!

Great option when dining at the TI. We've dined here several times now and have found the service to be quite good and the food is well prepared. The trout is always very fresh and balanced well with veggies and rice.

We'll be back whenever we're near the TI.

Tip- Look for the BOGO coupon that is usually included with check in materials...

It was a pretty meh experience with high costs. Had to wait about 15 mins despite half the restaurant empty on a Tuesday night at 530pm. Food was okay, but definitely not worth the price. $80 for three of us. Would not go back again unfortunately.

I definitely recommend this place. Last time I was in Vegas I stayed at Treasure Island. I  chose the Seafood Shack for dinner because the line at the buffet was way too long. I sat at the bar and the bartender was attentive and pleasant.

I chose the fried shrimp platter for dinner.  It came with fries and cole slaw. You get big pieces of meaty shrimp, not at all greasy. The fries were also quite good. The fries had the skin still on, which I prefer. The beer was a pale ale (I forget the name) the tap was shaped like a red lighthouse. The beer was perfectly cold and had a nice bite to it. The beer was an excellent complement to the shrimp. The beer was so good that I ordered another one :)

If you are wary of eating seafood in the middle of the desert, don't be! This was as good a seafood dinner as any I've had on the East coast.

This place was excellent...maybe I was drinking, maybe I was starving after leaving the Cirque show but damn, their fish and chips and coconut shrimp were amazing!! No seriously, add to that excellent service and that fact that since I stayed at TI I had a two for one coupon they gave me at check in...that I totally forgot about but she added it before I even asked...this place was great.

Food 10
Service 10
Atmosphere 10

SOLD...I would go back... like tomorrow if I could, get the Fish-N-chips :)

We went here for dinner before seeing Mystiere. Since it is only about 200 feet from the showroom inside the Treasure Island Casino/Hotel it was very convenient. Before getting to the restaurant I must inject that the Treasure Island does not charge for parking which is a big plus. Many hotels on the strip now charge for parking and as Las Vegas residents we almost never go near the strip because of the paid parking situation. I know the hotels must think this is a great revenue source but they have lost our business and that of many other people we talk to.  So, the fact that Treasure Island does not charge for parking is huge, at least to me. Anyway, back to the food. The Seafood Shack has a nice décor, nothing fancy but very appropriate. The service was excellent and efficient. I had the Pan Roast with scallops, mussels, clams, shrimp, and half a lobster. It came in a cream sauce. It was delicious but cracking the lobster claw was a little messy so be prepared. The rice pilaf was as good as I have ever had. The "seasonal vegetable" was broccoli and it was undercooked for my taste. Where it had been cut at the stalk it was "dark" which makes me believe it had been cut a day or two before. It was edible but just didn't give off a great appearance/presentation. My wife had the Lobster Cobb Salad which she really enjoyed. We asked our server whether the lobster would be claw meat of tail and he wasn't sure but thought it was claw meat. When it came it looked more like Langostino meat based on size and color. We had a Strawberry Shortcake dessert and it was good. We aren't drinkers so our two dinners, one dessert and one coffee came out at about $83. Add a 20% tip and we got out at just barely under $100. Everything we looked at as the servers walked by looked good. Overall this is not an "OMG I can't wait to go there again!" type place. But it is very good and if we find ourselves back near the Treasure Island for dinner we will not hesitate in going here again.

What an amazing meal ! I rarely do reviews, but literally my wife and I just got back from the Bahamas at sandals where the food was fresh and amazing, but hands down this place was better ! I kid you not ! We ordered the lobster and seafood stuffed mushrooms, the crab cakes and we split the Cajun seafood pasta ... To make matters even better the service was amazing we had wakeen as a server. When we come back to Vegas we will be coming here every time. P.S. the mojitos here rock!

This was a good place to eat close by our hotel and it wasn't too expensive. The lobster fritter appetizer was very tasty. The blue cheese dressing on the cob salad was good. We liked the margaritas as well. I would say this is a nice place to go get some seafood for the price.

Suprisngly very good. A little pricy but come on its vegas. We came in with the whole family and everyone really enjoyed the food. I tried pieces from everyone's, and everything was full of flavor and fresh. Drinks were strong and good. Kelly served us and was great. Next time in Vegas I'll have to stop back in.
Amazing food and better then buffetm, our bar bartend era std and Sergio are awesome.

We were hungover, hungry and needed to use my Groupon before it expired so off to Seafood Shack we went.. I hadn't been to the Treasure Island in forever! Inside the casino, the restaurants, the restrooms, everywhere...it smells like a mix of cigarette smoke and Banana Boat lol 

The atmosphere of the restaurant is cute.. think of an upgraded Joe's Crab Shack.. Our waiter was friendly and the food came out at a decent pace..

*Clam chowder in sourdough bread bowl- the chowder was nothing special but the bread was good.
*Crab cakes come with 3 small pieces.. Though they were small, they tasted like they barely had any filler in them.. just lots of crab meat..
*Blackened Chicken- came out piping hot and moist
*Seafood Pasta- lots of pieces of crawfish and shrimp in a creamy sauce
*Lobster roll- mehh.. Lobster meat tasted fake..

Before the discount the bill came up to around $85.. Would I come here again? Probably not.. Don't know if this is just a coincidence but my boyfriend and I both had stomach aches that night...
Unbelievably good!  We stopped here last minute and wasn't expecting much.  But, it was our favorite meal of the trip!!
The service was excellent starting from the phone call to make the reservation... The food was excellent.  Everything was delicious including the service... I recommend theshrimp and avocado salad
Wife and I tried this place with a GroupOn deal.  What we ordered was okay and we will probably go back but wouldn't get the same thing again.

Went here for dinner and it's about average food. The wedge salad is decent but it could have used a bit more bleu cheese for the size, I ate a lot of just lettuce with no toppings. The lobster roll was a bit below average with not that much flavor for some reason but the fries were pretty good. I would maybe pass this one up if you are looking for really good seafood

Bar tender Sydney went beyond customer service! He was working hard and still made us our drinks on time, didn't take long. Really nice, and gave us more options than they had. The night shift guys aren't that pleasant, but when we came back in the morning he was back and remembered us, and hooked it up with no problems. Deserves a raise

We're try to grab a bite before the show. We have lobsters and crab stuff with mushrooms is very good My husband order fish sandwich . I order sea bass with pilaf rice grill veggies. This plate veggies the best grill sea bass I have to squeeze lemon tons black pepper to kill the smell of fishy. When you combo this 2 to kill a fishy smell not good at all.Over all not sure I want to recommend this place or not. But definitely I'll not come back.

I ordered nachos during happy hour.  There were soggy chips at bottom of my nachos due to placing chips on top of the cream sauce (which was similar to sour cream, which I asked to be taken off). It took 40 minutes for me to get this small plate of nachos.  These were the worst nachos I think I have ever had (even compared to fast food places).  I do not recommend eating nachos here.
The menu looked exciting, a lot of tasty-sounding food. I ordered the Cajun Seafood Pasta, which was good, but not great.  But my sister ordered the oyster po-boy, and that was very tasty.

3 stars because the food was over priced. But 5 for the taste and service. Our server was very nice attentive. I had a stuffed lobster and crab salmon. Salmon wasn't actually stuffed. The stuffing was sitting on top, but the dish was phenomenal. Atmosphere was nice and you can see the cooks cooking in the kitchen. We also had the appetizer, lobster beignets. Delicious, but once again over priced for just 3. I wouldn't go back.

We had a really good meal here on a Wednesday night. We came here before seeing a show at the Wynn. 

It wasn't particularly busy and we were seated quickly. Our server was excellent, friendly, good service and checked with us regularly.  The woman who was serving the water was a complete sweetheart.  Such a nice person!  

The food was really good! Apps, main courses....it delivered.  And good operations too.  Not too little, not too small. 

We'll definitely be coming back here next time we visit Vegas.

We came here on a Tuesday evening and ordered 
1. Fisherman's platter (25)
2. Cajun seafood pasta (19) 
for $12 (used the Groupon deal $20 for $40)  

- Inside T.I. Look for a bar and a ship along the side. 
- Similar to Joe's crab shack, but not shack looking. 
- Quick seating and fast service. Greeted by the hostess. We got seated right away and was assisted by the waiter a few moments later. Another served us our water. We ordered right away and literally got our food in less then 10min. Amazing! Suspiciously, too fast, yet the food was fresh! 
- Fisherman's platter consisted of 2 scallops, 2 fish fillets, and a few fried shrimp, served with a side of cole slaw and fries. The platter tasted pretty good, not too remarkable though. 
-The Cajun seafood pasta was delicious. I was a bit afraid that it would taste too spicy, but it wasn't. There were pieces of crawfish and 2 that still in its shell and enough shrimp. It came with a side of garlic bread too. 
- They tax after they take off the 40 off, meaning that your bill is a whole lot cheaper!
- For what it's worth, I'd say that our meal tasted like a really fancy Long John's Silver, not as good as Joe's Crab Shack, but a your average mid class quick seafood was a nice dine experience. But because we used a Groupon, it made the entire experience worth my while!

Today was grand opening and we were the first customers in at 5PM -- I am a huge seafood fan and ordered the steamed clams which were excellent; my wife ordered the seafood platter which was also great. Prices are very reasonable for a seafood restaurant (let alone one inside of a Las Vegas casino). I would recommend this place to anyone looking for good seafood at a great price. My ONLY dislike was the small dessert menu, there were only 5 or so items (all cakes/pies).

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Now I wouldnt bo out of your way to.come here but if you want seafood, happen to be around tressure island or staying at tressurenisland then it's worth a try. We stayed at TI so we actually got a buy one entree get one free so really cant complain. Tried the crab stuffed salmon and the cajun scampi linguini. The salmon as far as the fish part was good I didn't care much for the stuffing. The scampis were large, fresh and they were not skimpy with the amount. The sauce was good and creamy and I really enjoyed it.

Over priced! Please eat somewhere else.

The Pan Roast I ordered sucked! I don't think they know how to make a pan roast! 
Crab cakes were small and nasty!

I hate my life right now!
Very fast service and delicious food. Excellent prices. We had lobster tacos, stuffed mushrooms, and shrimp cocktail. It was all delicious! Highly recommend.

The perfect dinner, not too fancy however several steps above cafeteria/buffet standards. Wasn't sure what to order so went with the suggestion of our server Daniel, the pan roast Valencia style, delicious. Everything cook as it should be, the scallops were so tender. Would definitely recommend.

The food here was great!  I got the seafood platter and the scallops and shrimp was so good.  I would def come here again. The waiting staff was so nice and attentive.  There wasn't alot of people in the resturant but it is worth trying out.

The Clam Chowder was good but the entree came in so late that we've already lost appetite, given that there were only a handful of customers when we were here. Could've been a lot better, in my opinion.
This was a happy find for us. We love our seafood and decided to give this a try. We were pleasantly surprised. Great meal. Two thumbs up. Will definitely return.

Food and waiter were amazing! However the hostess left a lot to be desired. She didn't greet anyone who walked up to her stand and after they stood there for a second she looked up and said, "how many"? We were then told it would be a 35 minute wait for a party of 3. I did a quick count and found 23 open and clean tables. So when I said something she snapped back showing me her "waitlist" (4 names). Very rude and unprofessional for a $200 dinner establishment.

Got the buy 1 get 1 free deal because I stayed at TI. With the coupon, the crap legs are worth ordering. The lobster and scallops were very underwhelming. Oh, above all else, the carrot cake was very mediocre, not worthy of a vegas meal.

The atmosphere, food, and wait staff were all incredible. Our server was Genaro and he made us feel like first class. Personalized service made this meal worth it. We will definitely be back in the future! Thank you, Genaro!

For the middle of the desert this place had great shrimp.  The staff was outstanding and very attentive to us. Even the manager of the hotel stop by and talked to us, very nice gentleman.  A great place to people watch as well.
The chef here is awesome!!!! Amazing Food and service!!!!! Hands down the best restaurant on strip!!!!

We stopped by for our 2-for-1 drink special. not a very cool environment, maybe it would have been better if Rick the bar tender wasn't such a downer.

Honestly Rick sucked and made me want to leave right away. I don't drink really and I had no idea what to get, he offered no help and simply said let me know when you are ready and walked away from us. 

I feel like if you are a bar tender you should be fun and social not sucky and crotchety.  The drinks were alright, I have definitely made better mojitos myself at home but i guess technically one was free, even though they cost some $10 and you cant get the happy hour mojito for $6 because of the 2-for-1 coupon. 

Either way I DON'T intend on stopping by here ever again. THANKS RICK!

I was hoping that this non-typical for Vegas Strip restaurant would make up for its rough hewn decorations for out of this world seafood.  I would define it is as edible.  Definitely not a destination when you want to try something different for a business client.  Better to get a basket of fried fish here.

Fancy diner,  with plenty of choices.   My salad was a bit limp. The lobster tacos just so so, kind of boring on the sauce.  But overall fine.  Key lime pie and coffee,  were excellent.  With  ok service, a happy ending.

We looked at the yelp! menu for the restaurant, and were really excited about the Fried Clams. I even contacted the restaurant to confirm if they were "whole belly fried clams" or "clam strips'. The lady on the phone said, "whole belly fried clams". Our New England family members were over the moon for these "whole belly friend clams". We booked our reservation for 7 on Open Table, and we were on our way!

So, we get to the restaurant. We are seated. Menus are given to us. And,... (cue dun duh DUHHH music)... there were no Fried Clams on their restaurant menu. WTH. WTF. &^%$#)(*&%^%$.. Almost heartbroken, we asked the waitress about the Fried Clams. Nope. None. Zero. Zilch. We felt deceived and lied to. CRAP?! The head chef came out and told us about the predicament. The restaurant could not guarantee delivery of these clams, and therefore removed them for the menu. Due to the confusion, he gave us some Lobster Beignets.

The food. Lobster Cobb Salad, Crab Stuffed Salmon, Kids Salmon, Fried Calamari, Clams with Linguini, Dinner Salad and New England Clam Chowder. DELICIOUS!!!!! All of it. Just eat it. Eat it now. Eat it fast. EAT IT. 

I gave them 3 stars for the snafu. Albeit a BIG snafu. Food is excellent. Service was okay. 

Bottom line: It's good. Very good. Check the TI website for the REAL menu.

Ordered two orders of king crab legs. Chowder, seafood platter, salad, burger.

Everurhing from the sea tasted dirty and fishy.  I have seafood all the time so yes, i know how fishy is too fishy. 
Burger was good, fries not. 
Overall very disappointing considering these king crab leg dishes were 50$ ea. They did take it off the bill (after we told them to)

Never going  again.

Came here with the 2for 1 entree coupon that was given during check in. Food is way overpriced( even its in the casino), order the oyster with weird smell( I don't think it's fresh but friends said it's cooked oysters, yuk!)  drinks selection is average food tastes below average, but all entree is 25 or above. I feel like they mark the price based on coupon, will I come back? Not at all, no recommend to others, please spend your money elsewhere that at least offer good food

I really didn't thought the quality of the food did not substantiate the higher prices at this restaurant located inside Treasure Island. The one thing I did like is that the employees were always giving us samples of alcohol, although I don't really like to drink alcohol while eating food as it conflicts with the food.

Anyhow, I ordered a cup of clam chowder but in retrospect, I should have ordered the bowl because they ended up being the same price. Then, I had some oysters. These were pretty decent, but just make sure that your waiter brings you enough lemons to douse over the oysters. Then, my main dish was the cioppino. I was completely disappointed with this dish. It was not very good. It was very bland and lacked any sort of flavor with the combination of all the seafood. I recall cioppino that I have eaten at other restaurants being superior to the dish I had at Seafood Shack. When I received the bill, I was mad that I had to pay so much for a mediocre dinner. I wish I had gone somewhere else, but my friend chose our dinner destination. Fail.

OMG! Lobster Cobb salad is a must have.  It is a very generous portion with avocado, bacon and tomatoes.  I asked our server Kelly to get it without the spicy dressing and chose sweet honey mustard dressing and then drawn butter for the lobster.  The portion of lobster was great and very tasty.  I think the sweet honey mustard dressing was perfect with it as well.  My husband got the fisherman's platter and they did a wonderful job with it.  The batter was not greasy and very flavorful.
Our water glasses were never empty.
We are planning to come back for lunch as we have heard the chowder is great.
Not impressed at all. Both of us got lobster and it was not freshly steamed- was lukewarm at best. Fresh steamed veggies, but again - cold! Lobster was okay- but I've had MUCH better for $50.00

Went here on behalf of a Groupon.

Walking up to the actual restaurant, it looks like it's a really small bar so I was quite puzzled. But come to find out the Host led us into the back where there was an actual restaurant setting. They really went with the theme. From the walls, tables, chairs right down to the lobster-like claw salt & pepper shakers. It's actually really cute.

I had the Mermaid Mojito to start off which is a mojito with strawberries in it. The drink was pretty big but I didn't even get a hint of a buzz so either my tolerance went up because I consumed more alcohol while in Vegas or the bartender was sheisty. I go with option 2, just sayin'

Had the Angel Hair Pasta (No meat for Lent) which is pasta with tomatoes, garlic, basil & olive tapenade. It was not too bad, I have no complaints since I finished the whole thing. So I guess you can say their serving sizes are just right, they don't want to have to roll you out after eating there ;)

The service was awesome well, I guess the only thing that prevented me from giving it 5 stars is that the Host I guess kept checking us out & walking by at random times just to stare. I, of course was oblivious to this but my friend noticed it right off the bat & pointed it out every time he passed by. Sorta creepy if you ask me. Meh, whatevers.

I came with my friend Jacky for dinner and not only was the food beautifully presented but the flavor was amazing! The staff was really nice and chef Ice came out and spoke with us also. I've already referred a few people to the restaurant and will keep doing so!
Fantastic!!!! Bravo!! This restaurant is a Gem! The Preparation and presentation is fantastic!! I would drive Over 300 miles just to sit at their table to enjoy a marvelous meal!

I ate by the bar. Glass of water. I seen mixed reviews of this place so I figured I would start with an appetizer and if it was yummy move on to an entree. I chose the crab and spinach dip. It was a nice size portion for $12 bucks but the taste was bland as all out doors. It was plenty of crab in it also. I sent it back and got the lobster and seafood stuffed mushrooms. They were much better yet still lacking flavor. I didn't get an entree and I probably won't be back

Frank was one of the nicest servers I had here in Vegas ! He had a great personality and recommended me to try the mermaid mojito when I was there the night of my 21st birthday and man oh man did I love that drink. My boyfriend and I went back to get that drink everyday we were staying at treasure island before we would go out for the night . He by far made that restaurant fun and exciting to stop by . Whenever we would stop by we would hope to see him there again .

My apology to the servers because this isn't a reflection on them, we had very good service. The food however was below mediocre. Don't waste your time going here. There are many more restaurants in Vegas that you will enjoy more. This was the worst food we have had in Vegas. Long John Silver is better than this place.

I have seen  lot of positive reviews about this place so maybe we just hit them up on an off night. When I say off night, there literally was as many tables seated as there were on the wait staff. Yet somehow the service was extremely slow! Granted we did have a party of 8, there really wasn't a huge crowd and none of our orders were anything that required a special request to be met. Dinner took almost 2.5 hours and even though we complained to "the manager" about slow service, nothing was done to try make up for it. We got the usual "I'm sorry we will work on it" which means "we don't care, just pay our high prices and leave tourist". I could deal with the slow, inattentive service if they actually took our complaints seriously but this place clearly does not care about the needs of the customer. A highlight to the evening is when the waitress came out and sad to the table "don't worry the surprise birthday cake is still coming out". Uh...so I guess the surprise is ruined when you announce the surprise to the birthday gal. Wow...

During my trip to LV, I felt the need to only eat at the highest Yelp rated restaurants. The only downside about that was digging out a couple Benjamins to cater that. Food in LV is definitely overpriced! But what can you expect right? We had stayed at treasure island and passed by the seafood shack plenty of times but didn't turn our heads. One late very cold night we got really hungry and didn't want to go walking outside looking for food so where did we go? The seafood shack.
From the outside it doesn't look like an actual restaurant because you can only see the bar. Once you walk in, it's actually pretty big and very cutely decorated.
The food was great! Big portions, not dry, they were not stingy on the seafood.
Our waiter was also very very friendly and accommodating even when my dad was asking for his 7th bottle of beer. I wish I remembered the waiters name, but he definitely gave us a lot of attention!
We stayed there for a long time just chit chatting and never felt rushed. 

This was on the last day of our trip, wish we could've gave them a chance earlier!
